María established a store where she sells consumer products. She took advantage of this opportunity because there are no competing stores near her home. Her business is well-known in Tacuba and she has been managing it for eight years. María will use the loan she requested to restock her store with new merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business with new merchandise

loans.name: Loidaliza

texts.en:
Loidaliza V.'s main source of income comes from selling cellphone accessories and processed foods like longaniza and chorizo (pork sausages) in her community. She is 35 years old, married and has three school-age children. She is from the village of NHA, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. Loidaliza has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Loidaliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Loidaliza is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rahat

texts.en:
Rahat H. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and five children in the Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest four children, two daughters and two sons, all attend a local secondary school and his youngest daughter is in kindergarten. 

H. operates a small billiards area at the local market in his town. He owns two billiards tables located in an outdoor area of the market that people can use when they come to shop. His tables earn on average 10,000 tugrugs (about $7) profit a day. H. started his business in 2004 and has enjoyed operating the billiards tables. His business is a popular spot in the market, but because it is outdoors, he cannot operate in the wintertime. 

H. hopes he can save enough money in the near future to own his own indoor place for his billiards tables. He is requesting a 300,000 tugrug loan to purchase coal to heat his home and a cow to eat this winter.

loans.use: To heat his home and to buy a cow to eat this winter

loans.name: Rose Jerotich

texts.en:
Rose is a vegetable vendor who is married and blessed with three children. Her business is located at Tembeleo in Eldoret.

She was introduced to KADET, a Kiva partner, by another group. With the loan she is taking from KADET, she will buy a sack of vegetables to sell. Her future dreams are to improve her business and to be able to provide basic needs for her dependents.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a sack of vegetables to sell to customers

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa Del Carmen R. de 60 años de edad, es madre soltera vive junto a su única hija quien es el orgullo de esta madre, residen en la capital del país el departamento de San Salvador. Rosa posee una tienda de productos de consumo donde ella genera las ganancias necesarias para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Rosa solicita de este crédito comprometida a pagar de manera puntual, el destino del crédito será para surtir el negocio de Mirna.
texts.en:
Rosa Del Carmen R. is 60 years old, a single mother, and a resident of San Salvador. She lives with her only daughter, who is very proud of her mother. Rosa manages a store where she sells consumer products and generates income to cover her living expenses. She is requesting a loan to restock her business and promises to submit her payments in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business with additional merchandise

loans.name: Kikelome

texts.en: A. is 40 years old and married, with 4 children. She sells electronics and other goods. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. She has been in LAPO for 2 years. She is requesting a loan for the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more electronics to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: María Delia

texts.es: María Delia H. D. V. resiD. del departamento D. La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 15 y 10 años D. edad. María tiene nueve años D. tener su negocio, es un tortillería la cual comenzó con idea D. apoyar a su esposo y obtener ingresos para los gatos D. su familia, ahora su negocio es muy conocido y preferido por muchos el deseo D. María es poder aumentar su producción y así poder seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Delia H. D. V. lives in the department of La Libertad with her husband and their two children, ages 15 and 10. She has been in the business of making tortillas for 9 years. She came up with the idea to start a business because she wanted to help her husband by earning money to pay for family expenses. Now her business is well-known and preferred by many. María hopes to increase her production so that her business can continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to increase production

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde is married with 5 children, and she is 40 years old. She sells blocks and cement. She has been in this line of business for over 15 years now. She is from Oyo State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan for the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more cement. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cement and other materials for her business

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn L. is from the village of San Juan, Gingoog City. She is 33 years old. Emelyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Emelyn makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables and snacks such as coconut jelly and rice cakes in the local community. Emelyn has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory, and as working capital. Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Emelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to improve her current business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: San Juan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Chuluundorj

texts.en:
Chuluundorj H. currently operates three separate businesses in her town with the help of her husband. Their businesses include coal trading, a cafe and a taxi service. H. spends most of her time managing the cafe during the day and drives a taxi in the evening. Her husband is responsible for managing the coal trading business.

H. is 35 years old and lives with her husband, son and daughter in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her son is a secondary school student and her daughter is in kindergarten.

H. and her husband started all of their businesses in 2004 after selling grocery items for the previous four years. They have found success in all three ventures and have a strong customer base throughout their community. For the future, the couple is planning to expand the building their cafe is in. H. is requesting a 1,600,000 tugrug (~$1120 US) loan to purchase coal to sell.

loans.use: To purchase coal to sell

loans.name: Claide

texts.en:
Claide B.'s main source of income comes from selling ready-to-wear (RTW) clothes, cellphone accessories and other products in her community. She is 36 years old, married and has two school-age children. She is from the village of Scions, Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro City. Claide has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 pesos a month.

In 2008, Claide joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Claide has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 pesos from HSPFI. Claide is requesting a new loan of 17,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Yanira

texts.es: Yanira P. D. A. resiD. en el departamento D. Cuscatlán dentro del municipio D. Cojutepeque. Yanira tiene 62 años D. edad, vive solamente con su hija D. 11 años D. edad, quien se encuentra estudiando. Yanira es una mujer muy fuerte y luchadora, a través D. su negocio sostiene los gastos del hogar y su hija, Yanira tiene un puesto donD. venD. ropa usada, las ventas son diarias con una clientela estable, por estar en una zona con mucha afluencia, ahora ella solicita D. un crédito que le dé la oportunidad D. invertir en su negocio con mayor cantidad D. ropa para ofrecer a su clientes.
texts.en:
Yanira P. D. A. lives in the town of Cojutepeque that lies in the department of Cuscatlán. She is 62 years old and lives with her 11 year old daughter who is a student. Yanira is a strong woman with a fighting spirit. She maintains a secondhand clothing business in order to generate income for her household expenses and to support her daughter. She has a stable clientele who live in an affluent area and purchase from her on a daily basis.

Yanira is requesting a loan so that she can acquire a large quantity of clothing to offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business with additional inventory

loans.name: Vilma Estela

texts.es: Vilma Estela M. L. de 26 años de edad, reside en el departamento de la Libertad junto a su esposo y su hijo de 3 años de edad. Con el apoyo de su esposo y unos ahorros que tenia esta pareja de esposas, Vilma logro montar su propio negocio, es un chalet que se encuentra ubicado a las orillas de la calle, la cual es muy transtada, en el negocio de Vilma ella ofrece variedad de golosinas, bebidas  y comida rápida, ahora ella solicita de un crédito para poder incrementar su inventario en bebidas y otros.
texts.en:
Vilma Estela M. L. is 26 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad with her husband and 3 year old son. Using some of their family’s savings, Vilma and her husband opened a store on a busy street corner where she offers candy, soft drinks, and fast food. She is requesting a loan so that she can increase her inventory of beverages and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her store with additional inventory

loans.name: Togetherness Group

texts.en:
Togetherness is a group of three borrowers led by Kormasa T.. She is 32 years old and married with three children aged 3-14 years old, and their educational levels kindergarten-6th grade. She also cares for an orphan. She and her family live in the Tebomai community, downtown Voinjama, the capital of Lofa county, Northern Liberia. Kormasa is a 5th grade dropout due to poverty.

Kormasa's business is general goods. She buys general goods wholesale and sells retail on a table in the Voinjama main market. She has been running this business for six years and is hoping to improve the shop. She gives her customers good prices and talks well to them in order encourage them to continue buying from her. Her ability for hard work has made her a pillar for her family – business is her life.

Kormasa and her family depend on her business for their daily needs, because her husband is out of a job and their children need to be supported financially. Therefore, she needs this loan in order to purchase more general goods wholesale to improve her business. She dreams of giving her children a better education and building a house of their own.

loans.use: To purchase more general goods wholesale

loans.name: Marta Jeannette

texts.es: Marta Jeannette S. reside en el pueblo que la vio nacer Armenia en el departamento de Sonsonate. Marta tiene 23 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 5 y 3 años.  A pesar de ser tan joven Marta es una persona con el sentido de la responsabilidad muy marcado, ella da todo por su familia que son el motivo del día a día en su trabajo, Marta muy valiente se atrevió a instalar un negocio una venta de ropa, hace tres años el cual ha recibido una gran demanda en la zona, razón por la cual Marta solicita de un crédito para surtir su negocio y así provechar al máximo de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marta Jeannette S. lives in the town of Armenia in the department of Sonsonate. She is 23 years old and lives with her husband and two children, ages 5 and 3. Despite being so young, Marta has an innate sense of responsibility. She puts everything into her work so that she can provide for her family. Marta took a bold step in starting her business and it has now been in operation for three years. There is great demand in the area for her merchandise, so she is taking advantage of this opportunity by requesting a loan to restock her business and maximize her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to restock her business

loans.name: Olanitan

texts.en: Olanitan is 30 years old and married with two children. He has been selling cement for years. He uses part of the profit for family upkeep and invests the remaining profit in his business. He lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 naira to purchase more cement to sell. He says God bless Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase cement to sell

loans.name: Dinorah Gilma

texts.es: Dinorah Gilma G. D. C. resiD. en la capital del país San Salvador. Gilma tiene 53 anos D. edad, vive en casa propia con su hija y su nieto. Gilma apoya a su hija quien  es madre soltera,  esta abuelita muy trabajadora atienD. D. su negocio y del pequeño Omar su nieto, mientras su hija sale a trabajar. Gilma posee un taller D. costura el cual es atendido por ella, ahora ella solita D. un crédito para invertir en su negocio comprando materiales que son D. gran utilidad para todos sus trabajos entre ellos hilos, ajugas, zippers y sobre todo tela con la cual elabora diseños para luego comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Dinorah Gilma G. D. C. lives in the capital of San Salvador. She is 53 years old and lives in her own home with her daughter and grandson. Gilma supports her daughter, who is a single mother. This hardworking grandmother attends to her small sewing workshop and looks after her young grandson Omar while her daughter is at work.

Gilma is requesting a loan to buy sewing materials for her work such as thread, needles, zippers, and all types of fabric for making different styles of clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Santos Reyna

texts.es: Santos Reyna M. C. de 32 años de edad reside en el departamento de San Salvador, vive en casa de sus padres con sus  tres hijos de 20, 8 y 6 años de edad, el esposo de Santos se encuentra en Estados Unidos trabajando. Santos maneja su negocio con el cual lleva ya 7 años de experiencia en las ventas, ofrece variedad de cosméticos y otros productos de belleza, el puesto donde Santos tiene su negocio es en el centro de San Salvador, donde hay una afluencia muy grande todo día. Ahora ella solicita de un crédito para  seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Santos Reyna M. C. is 32 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador with her parents and her three children (ages 20, 8, and 6). Her husband works in the United States. For seven years, Santos has been managing her retail business in which she offers a variety of cosmetics and other beauty products. Her vending post is located in the central part of San Salvador where a large influx of people passes through every day.

Santos is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor Korol' is married with two daughters. He is a businessman from Kahovka. He runs a business offering shoe repair services at two locations in his home town. Viktor was forced to start this enterprise after the collapse of Soviet Union when his family had many financial needs. He has been in this trade for 15 years. His working capital amounts to 18,000 UAH. Monthly net profit is about 5,500 UAH.  

Viktor is seeking a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase additional raw materials and supplies for his shoe repair business. Viktor likes his work and is hoping to see his venture grow further and expand even more. Viktor is known as an entrepreneur of integrity and determination. We believe his commitment to his venture and personal characteristics will help him repay the current loan without any problems.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies for his business.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday cracks and sells palm cannel. He is 39 years old and married with 4 children. He lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. He has been in LAPO for over 2 years now. 

Sunday is requesting a loan of 120,000 NGN to purchase more palm cannel. He says a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm cannel.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with a 10-year-old son. She is an entrepreneur from Zhidachev where she sells cosmetics and fancy goods in the local market. She has been in this business for 9 years. One of the main attractions of her business is the variety of items Nataliya offers for sale. Presently she makes about 25,000 UAH in gross income while her net profit amounts to 5,000 UAH.

Nataliya is requesting a loan of 9,750 UAH to increase her assortment of merchandise. She would like to use additional financial assistance to grow her business even further. Nataliya loves what she is doing and looks forward to the future. She is grateful for the opportunity this business provides to sustain her family. We believe Nataliya's natural optimism and determination along with her responsibility and serious business approach will help her make all her dreams come true.

loans.use: To re-stock her merchandise.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta Alicia P. S. de 49 años de edad reside en el departamento de San Salvador con su esposo quien es comerciante y sus tres hijos, dos de ellos estudiantes y uno el mayor de edad universitario, para Marta brindarle educación a su hijos es importante, ya desea la superación profesional de cada uno de ellos  que con mucho esfuerzos Marta y su esposo han brindado a sus hijos. Marta posee su propio negocio en el mercado Excuartel, donde vende productos hechos en El Salvador, sus ventas son estables ya que muchos conocen de este mercado por su concepto típico, ahora ella solicita de un crédito para surtir su negocio con nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Marta Alicia P. S. is 49 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador. Her husband is a merchant. Two of her three children are still in school, while her oldest child has already started university. Providing for her children’s education is an important priority for Marta. She hopes each of them will develop professionally. Marta and her husband work extremely hard to provide for their children.

She manages her own business at the Excuartel Market, where she sells products made in El Salvador. Her sales are stable and her business is known throughout the market for its traditional handicrafts. Marta is currently requesting a loan so that she can restock her business with new products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new products for her business

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with two children. She lives in Stryi, where she runs a small clothing-sales business in one of the local marketplaces. Oksana’s vending kiosk is well-known at the market for prices that are always affordable for an average customer and for the good quality of her merchandise. Oksana started her business only two years ago. Due to her diligence and hard work, she managed to grow and develop her business despite all economic struggles. Currently, she has about 6,500 Grivnyas in working capital.  

Oksana is seeking a loan of 6,500 Grivnyas to increase her stock of assorted merchandise for sale. She is hoping to continue growing her enterprise and increase her sales. She believes this type of merchandise will always be in demand, which is why she wants to continue working in this sphere of market vending.  

Note: In the photo, Oksana is with her husband in front of her vending kiosk.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: God Answer Prayer Group

texts.en:
God Answer prayer is a group of 4 borrowers which is led by Saysay B.. Saysay is a 42-year-old married man with 8 children between the ages of 1 and 24 years old (and their educational levels are between kindergarten and 11th grade). He is a high school graduate, but he could not continue on to university due to a lack of financial support. Saysay and his family live in the sheriff Quarter, a large Muslim community in Voinjama, the capital of Lofa county in northern Liberia.

Saysay is engaged in the business of selling used clothing. Specifically, he buys used clothes wholesale and then sells the clothes in the main market of Voinjama. He has been operating this business for 4 years, and he is hoping to improve the business in coming months. He explains that he serves his customers in a humble fashion and that he talks to his customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue to purchase from him.

Because Saysay has to support his family and because he is always striving to improve his family's standard of living, he takes his business very seriously. He needs this loan in order to purchase more used clothing at wholesale prices in order to improve the business. Saysay dreams of giving his children a better education.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar A. is separated and the father of Aisha Anwar, who is three years old. He is employed as a truck driver with one of the leading truck companies in East and Central Africa. He is also a businessman dealing with food cereals. He purchases cereals from Uganda and transports them to Mombasa, where he sells them at a wholesale price to various cereal stores in the city. He has been in the business for nine years now.

Anwar A. was introduced to KADET, a Kiva partner, by a friend. This is his first loan. With the loan, he intends to purchase cereals in Uganda to sell at wholesale prices to cereal stores in Mombasa.

His dream is to one day own his own truck.
 
About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase cereals from Uganda to sell in Mombasa

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine B. is 32 years old and is married with two children. She also takes care of two dependents who are 6 and 17 years old. Delphine lives in Gasabo district, in Kigali, the capital city.

Delphine is a proven entrepreneur with ten years of experience. She sells a variety of goods in her small grocery store as her photo indicates. She employs one person in her shop and the hours of operation are from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Delphine is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to expand her business. She will  use the loan to purchase more variety of attractive goods such as soft drinks, biscuits (cookies), sweets (candies) and novelties which she hopes will appeal to her existing customer base and attract new customers as well.

By receiving and using this loan prudently, and with the hoped for profit from the expansion of her business, Delphine will be able to set aside savings to take care of her family and dependents.

loans.use: To buy a variety of attractive goods for her store

loans.name: Abdoul Haddi Boulkassoum

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoul Haddi Boulkassoum M. est un homme marié de 30 ans et père de 4 enfants qui vit avec son épouse et ses enfants chez lui même dans le  quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de  Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après des études coraniques au village natal, il s’intéressa à plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus telles faire le berger et l'éleveur toujours au village et cela  pendant plus de 5 ans. Afin d’élargir ses horizons il décide de venir s’installer en ville où il appris pendant quelques années, auprès d’un ami le commerce  d’achat et  de vente de chaussures. Avec une expérience de 5 ans dans cette activité, il maîtrise bien son activité et est très apprécié et sollicité.
Dans le souci de renforcer ses activités, il décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier  prêt qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter des chaussures,  à Bamako, Lomé et au Burkina Faso. 
Avec une clientèle  composée de toute la population locale, les fêtes religieuses et les fêtes de fin d’année constituent les périodes où il réalise beaucoup plus de ventes  généralement au comptant. 
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA  
Il ambitionne dans les années à venir ouvrir une boutique de vente de chaussures à Bougouni.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoul Haddi Boulkassoum M. is a 30 year old married man and father of 4 children who lives with his wife and his children in his own place in the Hérémakono Nord neighborhood of the town of Bougouni (in the third administrative region of the republic of Mali). After studying the Koran in his birth village, he became interested in several revenue generating activities such as being a shepherd and breeder. He remained in the same village for more than 5 years. In order to broaden his horizons he decided to come live in the town where he studied for a few years, near a friend, doing business buying and selling shoes. With 5 years of experience in this business, he runs his business well and is very appreciated and in demand. With the intention of strengthening his business, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his first loan that he intends to use to purchase shoes in Bamako, Lomé and Burkina Faso. With a clientele composed of all of the local population, religious celebrations and end of the year celebrations make up the periods when he makes many more sales, generally in cash. With this loan, he counts on making a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA . In the years to come he aspires to open a shoe store in Bougouni.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est divorcée et vit avec ses 5 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KAMBENG DOUMASSOU depuis 8 ans. Avec son crédit elle fait du petit commerce; elle vend du tissu, des chaussures, des jus naturels, de la crème glacée et de l'eau fraiche. Les bénéfices réalisés de son activité lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
47-year-old Fatou D. is divorced and lives with her 5 dependent children. She has been a member of the Kambeng Doumassou Village Bank for 8 years. She runs a small business with her loan: she sells cloth, shoes, natural juices, ice cream and fresh water. The generated profits allow her to help improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Liliose

texts.en:
Liliose K. is 32 years old and is divorced with three children aged between 9 to 12 years. Liliose and her family live in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Recognizing the need to make a living for herself, Liliose started her business of making dresses and decorations just one year ago. Her business is open from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Liliose is now requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of adding to her working capital and purchasing more and better quality materials at better prices and in greater quantities in order to attract new customers and earn more profit.

Through accessing this loan, if her expansion plans are successful, Liliose will be able to continue her life as a self-employed woman with a successful enterprise. The savings from additional profits that are not reinvested in her business will allow her to take even better care of her three children.

loans.use: To buy more and better quality materials

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah K. is 37 years old and is married with four children aged between 13 and 16 years. She also takes care of two dependents from another family. Sara lives in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Since 2004, Sarah has owned a small shop selling various styles of clothes for men and women. This is her fifth year of successful operation in her business! The hours of her shop are from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day.

Sarah is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to expand her business through purchasing some other attractive clothing styles for sale as well as additional sizes and colors.

With this loan, Sara hopes to attract more customers to her shop and hopefully earn more profit in the process. This, in turn will allow her and her devoted husband to buy a house they have long dreamed of owning. Also, it will allow her to continue paying school fees and provide more and better food for her family and dependents.

loans.use: To buy more variety and sizes of clothing

loans.name: Esperence

texts.en:
Esperence N. is 27 years old, single, and she lives in the Northern Province of Rwanda, approximately three hours drive from the capital city of Kigali. Her village, called Nyabihu, is where, for four years, she has had her business sewing various models of clothing and materials for all occasions.

Although Esperence has been in business since 2005, her profit is still too low to expand meaningfully and she believes that a small amount of additional capital would change that for her. For that reason, she is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company (VFC) to purchase an additional sewing machine plus some other materials which will make her more efficient and effective and more successful. She thanks VFC and Kiva lenders for their support!

With this loan, Esperence hopes to earn more profit than before which, in turn, will help her to save for the future and create more jobs for various people.

loans.use: To buy an additional sewing machine and other material

loans.name: María Edith

texts.es: María Edith M. D. F. D. 59 años D. edad resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador. María vive con sus tres hijos y un nieto D. 5 años D. edad, María ha dedicado la mitad D. su vida trabajando en su negocio con el cual ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, hace veinticinco años ella inicio su negocio D. venta D. tortillas, ahora también posee un pequeño inventario D. ropa para ofrecer a sus clientes, con estos dos negocios María logra  generar ingresos para sostener su hogar, pero ahora ella solicita D. un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, la cual ha tenido una gran demanda por sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Edith M. D. F. is 59 years of age and lives in the department of San Salvador. María lives with her three children and her five year old grandson. Maria has spent half of her life working in her business which is how she has been able to get her children ahead. Maria started her business 25 years ago making tortillas, and now she has a small stock of clothes to offer to her customers. With these two businesses Maria has been able to generate enough income to sustain her home, but now she is requesting a loan to buy more clothes, since this is in great demand by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her new business

loans.name: Zelezetea Group

texts.en:
Zelezetea is a group of 5 borrowers which is led by Abu S.. Abu is a 30-year-old married man with 3 children who are between the ages of 1 and 4 years old. His children are not yet in school. Mostly because he grew up in poverty, he is illiterate. Abu and his family live in Ziggida, a small town close to Zorzor, a district in Lofa county in northern Liberia.

Abu operates a business where he sells general goods such as toothpaste, sugar, and milk. He buys these goods at wholesale prices and then sells the goods on a table at retail prices to local customers. He has been running this business for 5 years, and he hopes to improve the business so that he can sell his goods at a larger table. He explains that he talks to his customers in a kind manner and that he sells quality products in order to encourage them to continue to purchase their goods from him.

Due to the civil war in his country, Abu and his family lost everything, but they are trying to get back on their feet so to speak with business activities. Indeed, he and his family depend on his business for their day-to-day needs. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase more general goods at wholesale prices. Abu dreams of sending his children to school and of improving his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional goods (e.g., sugar, milk, and toothpaste)

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos R. G. reside en el municipio de Santa Tecla departamento La Libertad. Con 33 años de edad Juan es un hombre soltero, pero padre de un niño llamado Juan Carlos con  un año de edad. Juan vive con su madre y su hijo, por fortuna el cuenta con el apoyo de su madre quien cuida del niño mientras Juan sale a trabajar en su negocio que se encuentra ubicado en el mercado municipal, vende chorizos, hechos por él, ahora solita de un crédito con el cual pueda comprar materia prima para aumentar su inventario de chorizos y así poder  incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos resides in the municipality of Santa Tecla, La Libertad Department. He is 33 years of age, single, and the father of a 1 year old boy also named Juan Carlos. Juan lives with his mother and his son. Fortunately, he can count on the help of his mother who cares for the child while Juan goes out to work in his business, which is located in the municipal market. He sells sausages, which he himself makes.

Juan is soliciting a loan to buy basic materials with which to expand his inventory of sausages and, thus, increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY BASIC MATERIALS FOR MAKING SAUSAGES

loans.name: Marta Elizabeth

texts.es: Marta Elizabeth G. R. reside en Colon en el departamento de La Libertad. Marta tiene 42 años de edad es madre soltera y vive solamente con sus dos hijos Gabriela de 21 años de edad y Felipe de 18 años de edad, ambos estudiantes. Marta maneja su propio negocio donde vende productos cosméticos y ropa, para Marta ha sido difícil su estabilización económica ya que no cuenta con el apoyo económico de nadie, pero ahora con su negocio encuentra estabilidad ya que sus ventas son frecuentes, ella esta solicitando de este crédito para poder surtir su inventario en productos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Marta Elizabeth G. R. lives in Colon in the La Libertad department. Marta, 42, is a single mother. She lives alone with her two children; Gabriela who is 21, and Felipe who is 18. Both of them are students. Marta manages her own business selling cosmetic products and clothes. It has been difficult for Marta to stabilize her economic situation because she does not receive economic support from anyone. Now that her business is stable and she has frequent sales, she is asking for a loan to be able to stock her inventory with products for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory

loans.name: Andre

texts.en:
Andre K. is 41 years old and is divorced with three children, plus he also takes care of one dependent. The children are aged between 6 and 9 years. Andre lives in the Rubavu district of the city of Gisenyi, which is a three-hour drive from the the capital city of Rwanda.

By necessity, K. has been an entrepreneur selling hens for just one year now but his business is succeeding. He employs one person in his business and he works long days - 12 hours or more.

K. is now requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company. The purpose of the loan is to purchase more hens and supplies. With this loan, he hopes that he will become more competitive and attract more customers. All of this will hopefully result in his earning more profit, which in turn will help him to pay school fees for his children, provide more food for his family, and provide a more secure future for them as well.

loans.use: To buy more hens and supplies

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina A. is from the village of Dalapang Ozamiz City. She is 40 years old. Melodina is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Melodina plants & harvests cassava for sale. Melodina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Melodina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melodina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Melodina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Melodina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to pay for daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Tytus

texts.en:
S. is a 25-year-old married father of three daughters, who are between the ages of three and nine. He has run his tailoring business, Lady B House of Creation, for 11 years and earns extra income selling cereals. He says that he has built a good base of reliable clients and would like to employ many as he expands the business. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy material, thread, and a sewing machine. He hopes to be able to build a home and buy a car in the future. He describes himself as keen, humble, and courageous.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add stock of fabric, thread and purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es: María Dolores V. S. D. T. resiD. en San Pedro Masahuat en el departamento D. La Paz. María tiene 35 años D. edad, es madre soltera vive en casa D. su madre con su dos hijos Melisa D. 13 años y Judith D. 5 años. María ha creado su propio negocio en el cual elabora desD. su casa, D. manera artesanal y muy típica cortando  rodajitas muy delgadas  D. plátanos, luego las pone a freír, hasta que toman una consistencia crocante, este es un platillo muy típico en Nicaragua y El Salvador, el cual se come como una golosina, D. estos platinos María fabrica todos los días para luego ser embolsados y distribuidos en varias zonas D. su pueblo, pero ahora María solicita D. un crédito,  ya que desea compra mayor cantidad D. insumos para poder incrementar su producción y distribución.
texts.en:
María Dolores V. S. D. T. lives in San Pedro Masahuat in the department of La Paz. María is a 35 year-old single mother who lives in her mother's house with her two daughters Melisa (13) and Judith (5). María has started her own business out of her home cutting plantains into thin slices and then frying them until they are crunchy. This is a typical snack in Nicaragua and El Salvador. Every day María makes these snacks and later bags them and sells them in various locations in her town. María applied for the loan because she wishes to buy more supplies in order to increase her production and distribution.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: María Carmelina

texts.es: María Carmelina D. D. R. D. 49 años D. edad resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. María lleva años dedicándose a la venta D. pan, razón por la cual es muy conocida por muchos, ella llega con su canasto a muchas colonias, pero ahora sus clientes no solo quieren francés, también le piden pan dulce y galletas, motivo por el cual María solicita D. un crédito para poder invertir en otro tipo D. pan para ofrecer a sus clientes y a su vez le ayudara a incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María Carmelina D. D. R. is 49 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador with her husband and three children. For years María has worked selling bread and has become well known for it. She brings her basket to sell in many neighborhoods. but now her clients ask her for sweet bread and cookies as well as french bread. This is why María is applying for the loan so that she can invest in other types of bread to offer her clients and thus increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 32-year-old married mother of two daughters. She has run a boutique selling new clothes for five years. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to purchase a new stock of clothing. In the future, she hopes to increase her family’s living standards and purchase a plot of land on which to build a home and a permanent business place. She describes herself as hardworking and says that since became a member of Faulu she has learned better savings skills.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of clothes

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es: Porfirio R. L. de 52 años de edad reside en el departamento de San Salvador. Porfirio vive con su esposa y un hijo de 18 años de edad, estudiante. Porfirio tiene un negocio en una zona muy céntrica y de mucha afluencia, el ofrece variedades de frutas según lo que este de la temporada y cosecha, la mayoría de tiempo en el año, el coco nunca falta, pero hay ciertas frutas que siempre solicitan sus clientes que Porfirio debe surtir su inventario, y es por este motivo que solicita de un  crédito el cual destinara para  comprar frutas y bebidas.
texts.en:
Porfirio R. L. is 52 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador. Porfirio lives with his wife and his 18-year old son who is a student. Porfirio has a business in a centrally located and afluent area of town. He sells many types of fruit depending on what is in season and what has been harvested. For much of the year he sells coconut, but his clients always ask for certain fruits. So, Porfirio must offer a variety of products. He is seeking a loan to purchase more fruits and drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Augment Inventory

loans.name: Nurillo

texts.ru: Хучаев Нурилло проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 41 год. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Нурилло имеет среднее образование. Он более 5-ти лет занимается животноводством, откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для покупки скота, т.к. у него есть постоянные клиенты, т.е. спрос.
texts.en:
Nurillo H. lives in the Yavan district. He is 41 years old, married and has 5 children. Nurillo has secondary education. He has been involved in animal husbandry, raising and selling livestock, for over 5 years. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock because he has regular clients and, thus, demand.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Zevelekeze Group

texts.en:
Zevelekeze is a group of five borrowers led by Larwubah M., who is 26 years old and married with four children, ages 4 to 7 years old. The children are not yet in school because there are no funds to educate them. Larwubah himself is a 7th grade drop-out because of poverty. He and his family live in Ziggida Town, a small town close Zorzor, a district in Lofa county, in northern Liberia.

Larwubah’s business is the sales of peanuts. He buys peanuts wholesale from farmers and sells retail on a table to residents of Ziggida town. 
He has been running this business for two years and hoping to expand to a bigger table. Larwubah talks to his customers in a good manner and sells good peanuts to his customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from him.

Larwubah strives hard every day to feed his family. In Ziggida town,feeding an entire family is not an easy task. He must be very hard working because of poverty.
 
Larwubah needs this loan in order to purchase more peanuts wholesale to improve business. He dreams of educating his children, continuing his own education and improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more peanuts wholesale to improve business.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar Armando G. A. reside en Zaragoza en el departamento de La Libertad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas de 10 y 6 años de edad. Oscar tiene años de experiencia  trabajando con hojalata la cual aprendió en empleos anteriores, pero ahora Oscar maneja su propio negocio con los conocimientos adquiridos y su experiencia, son ocho años al mando de su negocio el cual ha ido creciendo y ganando clientes poco a poco, en el taller de Oscar se elaboran todo tipo de utensilios elaborados en ese tipo de lamina, la demanda de sus productos ha ido creciendo notablemente en estos últimos meses razón por la cual solicita de un crédito para comprar materiales que necesita para la fabricación de un pedido.
texts.en:
Oscar Armando G. A. lives in Zaragoza in the department of La Libertad. He lives with his wife and two daughters, 10 and 6 years old respectively. Oscar has years of experience working with tin plate, which he learned from previous jobs. With his knowledge and experience Oscar now has 8 years running his own business which has been growing and gaining clients little by little. In his shop Oscar makes all kinds of products made with this material. The demand for his products has been growing in the last few months, so he applied for a loan in order to purchase the materials he will need to complete his orders.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material/metal

loans.name: Aros

texts.en:
Aros is a 34-year-old married father of three who runs a tailoring business in Nyayo Market in Nairobi. He has many walk-in customers but also sells wholesale and is hired for weddings and other special functions. He has been in this business since 2005 but feels that since becoming a member of Faulu he has learned new discipline and time management skills. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more fabric and accessories. In the future, he hopes to open another shop and to have an exhibition to showcase his designs. He describes himself as a hard worker.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and accessories

loans.name: Mable

texts.en:
Mable is a 33-year-old married mother of two children, a boy and a girl. She has run her tailoring shop, Tailoring Mama Dan, for the last five years. She sells skirt suits, school uniforms, kitenge (African fabric), and children's clothing. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy more clothing material. Mable describes herself as visionary and hardworking and says that since she has become a member of Faulu she has learned to be a better saver. In the future, she hopes to grow her business into a big shop and employ people. 

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more fabric

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 25 years old and runs a shop in Nyayo Market in the Ngara area of Nairobi. He sells snacks, soft drinks, foodstuffs, and papers and employs two people. He has run this business for two years and is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to increase his current stock. In the future, he hopes to both expand his business into several shops and also to buy land on which to build houses. He describes himself as a dedicated worker.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is single. She lives in Berdyansk. Nadezhda owns two vending locations at different local markets. She sells men’s and women’s outer clothing and footwear. Nadezhda uses effective marketing techniques, which help her business stay sustainable and profitable. She launched her venture five years ago. Ever since, her turnover capital has increased to 10,000 Grivnyas. Her income amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Nadezhda is requesting a loan of 9,000 Grivnyas to increase assorted merchandise in her kiosks. She is an entrepreneur of integrity who can handle challenging situations and is always polite with customers. One of Nadezhda’s future plans is to open one more vending location and expand her business as a result.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Ramón Ernesto

texts.es: Ramón Ernesto D. reside en el municipio de Soyapango del departamento de San Salvador. Ramón tiene 49 años de edad vive con su esposa y su hija de 16 años de edad. Ramón se dedica a su propio negocio el cual ofrece servicios de transporte escolar, son siete años los que lleva al servicio de muchos niños, para Ramón es un gran peso llevar las responsabilidad de muchos niños a bordo de su microbús escolar, el trata de brindar la mayor calidad y seguridad a todos los niños que se transportan con él, es por eso que ahora el solicita un crédito, para someter a revisión su vehículo el cual tiene que estar en optimas condiciones para seguridad de sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Ramón Ernesto D. lives in the town of Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. Ramón is 49 years old and lives with his wife and his 16 year-old daughter. Ramón has run his own business driving a school bus for seven years. For Ramón, carrying so many children in his microbus is a great responsibility. He tries to offer quality service and safety to all the children, which is why he is applying for the loan. He wishes to have his vehicle inspected because it most be in prime condition for the security of his passengers.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inspection of school bus

loans.name: Ziggida Group

texts.en:
Ziggida United is a group of five borrowers led by Gayduo Y., who is 29 years old and married with two children. They are six and nine years old and their educational levels are 2nd and 4th grades. Gayduo herself is illiterate due to poverty. Gayduo and her family live in Ziggida Town, a small town close Zorzor, a district in Lofa county, in northern Liberia. Gayduo’s business is food preparation. She buys foodstuffs which she cooks and sells to residents in Ziggida town. She has been running this business for two years, hoping to expand her business into a restaurant. Gayduo’s cooked food is delicious and affordable, which encourages her customers to continue buying from her.

She started her business with a little money from her husband, but because of family responsibilities, Gayduo has been facing some financial constraints. Gayduo needs this loan in order to purchase more foodstuffs so she can cook more food for customers and improve business.

Because Ziggida town has a high rate of poverty, most residents can’t afford to cook their own food. They prefer buying prepared food to eat because it is cheap and is sold by the plate. Gayduo dreams of educating her children and improving their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook more food for customers and improve business.

loans.name: Alice Muthoni

texts.en: Alice Muthoni N., age 30, has a food shop selling chicken, cabbages, tomatoes, flour, sugar, tea leaves and cakes.  She has been particularly successful with her chickens, which she raises and sells to local hotels and prominent customers from the village where she lives.  She is using the proceeds of this loan to buy more chickens and feed.  Her business goal is to expand the poultry portion of her business and begin to raise Kenya Brown chickens.  Alice is a single mother of two girls, ages 11 and 12.  She describes herself as faithful, honest and hardworking.  She dreams of providing an education to her girls, being able to buy land, having her own house for her family and having more space to raise chickens.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and feed

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin H. is 25 years old, married with two children ages 2 and 3. Celestin and his family live in Nyamata district in the eastern province of Rwanda, approximately one hour from the capital city, Kigali. His village, called Nyamata, is where he has operated his successful business selling different kinds of grocery items and products for three years.

Celestin is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to purchase more different types of products and merchandise for sale which he hopes will attract new customers and help him to expand the sales of his business.  With the profit that he hopes to earn from this business expansion plan, he will be able to provide better a better quality of life for his family and a more secure future.

loans.use: Purchase more variety of inventory

loans.name: Jenipha

texts.en:
Jenipha Akinyi O.
Jenipha is a 53-year-old mother of five. She sells fish in Kawangware Market Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last three years. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 40,000 to buy ten sacks of Omena (small fish) for sale. She has successfully paid a loan of Kes. 20,000. Since joining Faulu, Jenipha says that her life has improved. She has grown from buying Omena in bits to buying in sacks. She hopes to be a leading supplier of Omena in Kawangware area and grow her business to a level that it can sustain her family. She describes herself as hardworking.
 
About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of fish

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Mohamed S.. Mohamed was born in Magbass village about seven miles from Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. Mohamed is married to a businesswoman and they have three children. One of his children is in class III and the other is in class II. The last is not yet of school age. 

Mohamed owns a video center and a call center where he makes both local and international calls for customers, recharges their mobile phones for a fee of SLL 1,000 and sell top-up cards. Mohamed wants a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to buy a generator, and a television and to invest in his wife’s business.

loans.use: To buy a generator and a TV and invest in his wife's business

loans.name: Paulo Kipkurui

texts.en:
Paulo is 24 years old and married. His dairy business is located at Tembeleo in Eldoret.

He was introduced to KADET,a Kiva partner, by a group member. With the loan he is taking from KADET, he plans to buy a cow. His future plan is to carry on as a dairy farmer and to be able to supply milk and meet the family's basic needs.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a cow for his dairy-supply business

loans.name: William Kiplagat

texts.en: William is 50 years old, married and is blessed with seven children. His bicycle business is located at Tembeleo in Eldoret. He was introduced to KADET by another business woman. With the loan he is taking from KADET he intends to buy spare parts for his bicycle repair business. His future plans are to open a spare parts shop and a garage for repairing bicycles and motorcycles so that he can better support his children. About KADET The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy spare parts for bicycle repair.

loans.name: Mary Jepkosgei

texts.en: Mary is married and blessed with seven children. Her cafe is located at Tembeleo in Eldoret. She was introduced to KADET by an existing borrower. With her loan, Mary is planning to purchase baking flour and cooking oil for her cafe. Her future dream is to buy a dairy cow to provide milk for sale in order to better support her family. About KADET The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en: Alpha C. is 30 years old. He is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. Alpha is seeking a loan of 1 million Leones in order to pay school fees for his children and to purchase materials for the family's home.

loans.use: School fees for his children

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda K. is a 28 year old fisherman who lives in Magbass with his wife and two children. He has been in the fish business for three years and is looking to invest in and expand his operations. For this purpose, Dauda is seeking a loan of 1 million Leones from SMT and Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To expand his fish-selling business.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward F. is 45. He wants a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones to pay school fees for his children. Edward is married to a businesswoman and they have five children. Two of the children are in secondary schools, one is in primary school and the other is not of school-going age.

loans.use: Pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan S. is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to help him pay school fees and other school related charges for his five children. Hassan was born in 1961 in the Kambia district, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a farmer and they have five children, four of whom are in secondary schools and the last is not of school going age.

loans.use: Pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Sorie

texts.en: Sorie S. is a 30 year old resident of Magbass who has been selling rice in the market for six years. Sorie has a wife who is also in business, and together they have one child. He is seeking a loan of 1 million Leones from SMT and Kiva Lenders to invest in his business and help it to grow.

loans.use: To expand his rice business

loans.name: Caroline Jelagat

texts.en:
Caroline Jelagat is 29 years old, married to Edwin, and has two children. Her business is located at Tembeleo.

She has been in her business, selling fruits and vegetables, for the past five years. With the loan she is taking from KADET, she intends to add more inventory to her business, specifically Kales (a form of cabbage). Her dreams are to buy a dairy cow and be able to provide for the basic needs of her family.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase her inventory of vegetables.

loans.name: Mother Blessing Group

texts.en:
Mother Blessing is a group of five borrowers led by Garmai W., who is 35 years old and married with four children between the ages of six and fifteen. Their educational levels are between the 2nd and 8th grades. Garmai herself is illiterate due to poverty. Garmai and her family live in Ziggida Town, a small town close Zorzor, a district in Lofa county, in northern Liberia. Garmai’s business is baking bread. She buys baking materials and ingredients like flour, sugar, baking powder, butter and eggs and bakes bread to sell to residents of Ziggida town. She has been running this business for five years and hoping to expand to a bigger bakery. Garmai’s bread is very nice and affordable, which encourages her customers to continue buying from her.

She started this business with a little money gathered from family and friends after the Liberian civil crisis, but because of family responsibilities, Garmai has been facing some financial constraints. She needs this loan in order to purchase more baking ingredients so she can continue to bake and serve her customers and improve her business. Garmai dreams of educating her children and building them a house.

loans.use: To purchase more baking ingredients so she can serve customers and improve business.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: Issa S. is a 28-year-old. He and his wife are business-people. They have three children. For six years, Issa has owned a market stall. He is now seeking a loan of 1 million Leones from SMT and Kiva lenders to invest in his rice-selling business.

loans.use: Expansion of business

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en:
Here is Mustapha G.. Mustapha wants a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to pay school fees and other school-related charges for his children. 

Thirty-year-old Mustapha is married and has five children. His children are attending schools: two are in primary schools and three are in secondary school.

loans.use: Pay school fees and other school-related charges

loans.name: Momoh

texts.en: This is Momoh Senkoh. Momoh is 30 years old, and lives and works in the town of Magbass with his wife and six children. He is seeking a loan of 1 million Leones from Kiva Lenders and SMT in order to pay school fees for his children, two of whom attend primary school and the rest attend secondary school.

loans.use: School fees for children

loans.name: Habibu

texts.en:
This is Habibu B.. Habibu is seeking his very first loan from Kiva lenders through SMT. He wants a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to help pay school fees for his children and to buy house-building materials. 

Habibu is now 35 and married with five children. Habibu’s children are attending schools: three are in secondary school and two are in primary school.

loans.use: Pay school fees and buy house-building materials

loans.name: Benoit's Group

texts.en:
Benoit M. is 42 years old and married with three children ages 3, 6, and 8. Benoit lives with his family in Kinyinya sector, Gasabo district in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, where his business has been operating since 2004. A successful entrepreneur, Benoit employs two people from his community in his business and the hours are from 6AM to 8PM daily.  In his general store, Benoit sells bulk items and products such as rice, salt, sugar, grains, flour etc...

Benoit is requesting his second loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to allow him to buy products in greater volumes and at lower prices which should increase his monthly profit and make him more competitive.  Over time, these changes will help him to expand his business even further which he wants to do in order to build a secure future for his family.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of grains and sugar, etc

loans.name: Elizabeth Jemaiyo

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old, married to William and has five children. Her business is located in Tembeleo in Eldoret.

With the loan she is taking from Kadet, Elizabeth intends to buy cooking oil, Unga flour and sugar to sell in her retail shop. Her future plans are to sell a wider variety of foodstuffs, to support her family by putting food on the table and to be able to afford to educate her children.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, Unga flour and sugar to sell in her retail shop

loans.name: Jemimah Priscillah

texts.en:
Jemimah is a 45-year-old mother of two. She operates a general store, a business she has had for the last year. Her husband assists her in transporting the stock from the wholesalers to her shop.

Jemimah learned about KADET Ltd., a Kiva partner, through her neighbor, who has been a KADET client for four years. This is Jemimah's first loan from KADET and with her loan, she will purchase more stock for her shop. She also intends to include charcoal among her stock items.

She aspires to develop a plot of land that she has already purchased and ultimately move her business there, as she currently operates from rented premises.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase stock in her general store and diversify into the charcoal business

loans.name: Margaret Jebet

texts.en:
Margaret is 39 years old, married and blessed with four children. Her business is located at Tembeleo in Eldoret.

She was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. With the loan she is taking from KADET, she intends to buy sugar, baking flour, and cooking oil to stock her small retail shop. Her dreams are to open a wholesale shop and be able to educate her children.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy merchandise to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Najjanakumbi E Nakito Sarah Group

texts.en: N. Sarah, 32, is a hardworking business lady, who is married with four children, three of whom are in school. She has been rearing poultry for over ten years. She will use the loan to purchase poultry drugs and feed, expand the poultry shade structure, and purchase chicks to replace the current inventory. She is very encouraging and her dream is to work very hard and provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase supplies, inventory, and expand the poultry shade structure.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is thirty-five year old Mohamed K.. Mohamed K. was born in a place called Rothombal, near Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. Mohamed is married with four children. All of his children are attending school, three of whom are in secondary schools and one in primary school. Mohamed is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 from Kiva lenders. This will the first loan he will access from SMT/Kiva. Mohamed wants this loan in order  to pay school fees and other school related charges for his children. Mohamed will also use part of the loan to buy house building materials.

loans.use: Pay school fees and other school related charges for his children

loans.name: David

texts.en: David G. was born in Makama, an outskirt of Makeni city. He is now age forty-four and married to a businesswoman. They have eight children who are attending primary and secondary schools. David is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for two purposes: 1) to complete the construction of his house, and 2) to invest in his business. He will thus use part of the loan to buy house building materials like cements, iron corrugated zincs and boards. The remainder he will use to invest in his market food business. David has been doing business for three years now.

loans.use: Use part to buy house building materials and part to invest in his business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan B. is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 from Kiva lenders. He wants this loan to buy house building materials like bags of cement, steel windows and boards. Hassan was born in Kamalo, about seven miles away from Makeni. He is thirty-six years old. He is married to businesswoman and they have five children. Two of his children are in secondary school and three are in primary school.

loans.use: Buy house building materials

loans.name: Edward A.

texts.en: Edward A. K. was born in 1961 in Bombali district, northern Sierra Leone. Edward is married and he is a father of three lovely children who are attending primary schools. Edward is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for the first time from Kiva through SMT. Edward will use this loan to pay school fees and other school related charges for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en: Here is John S., a 35-year-old man, who sells a number of items including bars of soap, Vaseline, toothbrushes and toothpaste, slippers/flip-flops and many more. He has been a businessman for six years now. John is married to a businesswoman and they have one child who is in class one. John wants a loan of 1,000,000 leones to invest in his business.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Karim

texts.en: Karim K., 40, is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 leones to pay school fees for his child and invest the rest in his wife’s business. Karim has two children, one is in Junior Secondary School I and the other is already married and living on his own. Karim’s wife sells market food and has been in the business for two years now.

loans.use: To invest in food business and pay school fees

loans.name: Pamela Awuor

texts.en:
Pamela Awour operates a shop and photocopy services in Manyatta, a low-income settlement on the outskirts of Kisumu City. She is 45 years old and the mother of two. The income from her business has enabled her to pay for her living expenses and send her children to school. Pamela has been in her business for three years.

This is Pamela's third loan from KADET Ltd. and she plans to use the funds to increase her stock in readiness for the approaching school closure and holidays – a period during which she hopes to increase her sales judging by the trends her business goes through annually. She hopes to open a wholesale outlet to be able to serve the community better while increasing her income levels.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store and photocopy services business

loans.name: Foday

texts.en: Foday K. is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to pay school fees and other school-related charges for his children. Foday is 34 and a father of five children. Three of Foday’s children are in primary schools and two are in Junior Secondary Schools.

loans.use: Pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Abdulai G. was born in the village of Gbonkolenken, in northern Sierra Leone. He is 45 years old. Abudlai’s wives sell food at the market. His first wife has been a business woman for seven years; his other wife has spent three years in the world of business. Abdulai has 13 children between the ages of 3 and 25. All of his children, except the youngest, attend school.

Abdulai is seeking a loan of about 1,000,000 Sierra Leone Leone (SLL). Part of the loan will be invested in his wives’ businesses and part will be used to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To invest in his family's food-selling business.

loans.name: C2583 Abitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Claude H. is 26 years old and single. Claude and his family live in Gasabo district, where he opened a shop in 2006 and employs five people in his business. His general store is open every day from 6 in the morning to 8 in the evening.  

Claude is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business, which will help him to earn more profit. With this profit he plans to save money so that he can buy his own house.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata BÂ est une femme de 20 ans, elle est mariée et a un enfant en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KAMBENG DOUMASSOU il y a deux ans de cela et y a reçu 4 prêts remboursés sans difficulté. Le crédit qu'elle a consenti ce cycle lui servira à renforcer sa boutique, elle vend du riz, de l’huile, du sucre du lait etc. Les bénéfices qu'elle réalise lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
20-year-old Fatoumata Bâ is married with one child. She has received and repaid 4 loans during her 2 years as a member of the Kambeng Doumassou Village Bank. She will use the loan granted during this loan cycle to restock her store; she sells rice, oil, sugar, milk, etc. The generated profits allow her to help improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business
