Now, with her business, their situation has improved a lot and she contributes for food and covers some of the bills when she can. Mr. Santos Isidro V. buys and sells pigs. He is also a farmer who grows basic grains like corn and beans. Mr. Santos leaves the town of Sta. Maria to buy his pigs and then brings them back to his home in a herd. A few days later a buyer comes and he sells the animals. Mr. Santos lives with his partner and doesn’t have any children. He only has a brother-in-law who relies on them because he lives with them due to illness. Mr. Santos is a person who is well known in Sta. Maria because of his business and also because he’s lived in this town for more than 30 years. Mr. JOSE FERMIN B. P. is in sales. He mostly sells plastics, rubber sandals, fruits and vegetables. He used to live in the capital, but because of marital problems he separated from his wife and came to live on the land he is from to raise two of his three children. Mr. José, is a man who struggles so he can educate his children who are in elementary school right now. Mr. B. buys plastic products and sandals in the capital and then sells them in communities and by coffee plantations near Sta. María. He has a car, so when he sells in coffee plantation areas he buys plantains and bananas and then sells them in the capital where he can get better prices since he’s doing two businesses in only one trip. All of these people need a loan so they can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sugar, TP, rice, lard, soap, pasta, milk, flour, eggs, coffee, cookies, bread, pigs, plastic utencil, fruits and veggies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: On top of being an entrepreneur, Veronica, age 40, takes care of her five children. Her children are all currently in school. She wants to make sure that she is financially able to support all of her children in receiving a quality education. She lives with her family in a rented apartment. Veronica is a food vendor and sells rice porridge to support her family. She has been in business for four years now. She will be adding soft drinks and meat pie to her business to supplement her income. Her food is highly patronized by people in her community, especially by school kids at breakfast. She is expecting higher profits, if she receives her loan. She believes in hard work, and your support really matters to her business progress.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients like rice, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una mujer dinámica y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 20 años, es madre de una niña, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de madera, actividad que realiza con su esposo. Mercedes forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Claritas 2” desde hace un año, su primer crédito fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en venta de gaseosas, leche fresca y yogurt.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será invertido en la compra de listones y tablas para su negocio de venta de materiales de construcción. La meta de Mercedes es tener una tienda de confecciones.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a dynamic and persistent woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, region of Ucayali, Peru. She is a 20-year-old mother of a young daughter and makes a living buying and selling wood, an activity she carries out with her husband. Mercedes has been a part of the "Las Claritas 2" Community Bank for the past year, and her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to invest in the purchase of soft drinks, fresh milk and yogurt to sell. Currently she is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles (approximately $350), which she plans to use to invest in the purchase of wooden beams and planks for her business selling construction materials. Mercedes' goal is to have a sewing shop.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wooden beams and planks

loans.name: John B.

texts.en: Here is John B. B.. John was born in Matamp village in northern Sierra Leone. He is forty-six years old, married to a businesswoman and they have six children. John’s children are attending both primary and secondary schools respectively. He wants a loan of SLL 1,000,000 in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: Pay school fees and other school related charges for his children

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es una socia trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa,  región de Ucayali tiene 52 años, madre de dos hijos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de madera en tablas y a la venta de repuestos de carros, este negocio lo realiza junto  con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” desde hace dos años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que utilizó en la compra de productos para la venta de comida, pues anteriormente vendía comida en su casa, en la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado en la compra de repuestos y accesorios para autos. La meta de Elizabeth es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hard-working and dynamic group member. She lives in Pucallpa, a city in Ucayali. She is 52 years old and the mother of two older children. She runs a lumber and car part business together with her husband. She has been a part of the village bank "Mujeres Valientes" or Brave Women for the last two years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles. She used it to buy products for a food business because previously she sold food from her home. Now, she needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy parts and other car accessories. Elizabeth's goal is to own a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy parts and car accessories.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa es una socia emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 31 años, es madre de tres hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica al alquiler de motocarro, actividad que realiza junto con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Victoriosas” desde hace un año, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles que lo utilizo en la compra de frutas y golosinas para vender en su casa, en la actualidad Elsa necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que utilizará para comprar un motocarro de segunda mano. La meta de Elsa es tener una tienda de repuestos y accesorios para motos y motocarro.
texts.en:
Elsa is an enterprising and hardworking member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 31 years older and is the mother of three younger children. She is involved in “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) rental, a business that she does together with her husband. She has been a part of the “Las Victoriosas” communal bank for the past year. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which she used for the purchase of fruits and candy to sell at her house.

Now, Elsa needs a loan of 1000 PEN, which she will use to purchase a second-hand “motocarro”. Elsa’s goal is to have a repair and accessory shop for “motos” and “motocarros”.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a second-hand "motorcarro"

loans.name: Azuma

texts.en: Azuma, age forty eight, is a widow and the mother of five children who are currently in school. She is a very hard working and resourceful mother. She works to support her children’s education to provide them with a better opportunity in life in the future. Azuma prepares and sells maize porridge together with milk and doughnuts. For the past ten years, Azuma has been supporting her family with income from this business. She found it necessary to add a second business of selling dried cassava to supplement her income when her husband died. With the loan, she wants to buy ingredients like maize, milk, sugar etc. in bulk. Being able to buy in bulk is advantageous because it is a hedge against price hikes and also helps avoid frequent travels to fill demand. She hopes to use part of her profit to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase maize and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali, tiene 49 años, es madre D. cinco hijos, todos mayores D. edad, Ruth se dedica a la venta D. zapatos, prendas D. vestir y perfumes, ella tiene este negocio en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que se dedica a la venta D. pasamanería. Forma parte del Banco Comunal”Mujeres  Virtuosas” desD. hace cuatro años,  el primer préstamo que recibió fue D. 300 soles, dinero que le permitió invertir en zapatos.
Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles que será utilizado para comprar correas, billeteras, carteras y zapatos D. cuero, ya que ella trae D. la ciudad D. Trujillo esta mercadería. La meta D. Ruth es  tener una tienda bien implementada D. artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Ruth is a dynamic and hardworking woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 49 years old and is the mother of five children, all of which are older. Ruth is involved in the sale of shoes, clothing, and perfumes. She has this business in her house, and has the support of her husband who is involved in the sale of passementerie. Ruth has been part of the “Mujeres Virtuosas” communal bank for the past four years. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which allowed her to invest in shoes.

Ruth currently needs a loan of 3000 PEN which she will use to purchase belts, wallets, purses, and leather shoes, since she brings this merchandise from the city of Trujillo. Ruth’s goal is to have a well set up store with household items.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase belts, wallets, purses, and leather shoes

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 53 años, es madre D. seis hijos, todos mayores D. edad,  se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y bebidas, pues tiene una bodega que funciona en su casa, su esposo trabaja con ella en esta bodega. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Solteritas” desD. hace seis años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en la compra D. bebidas, tales como gaseosas, néctar y jugos. Ahora Susana necesita un crédito D. 2300 soles que le permitirá invertir en productos para su bodega como gaseosas, fideos, arroz, azúcar, aceites, etc.. La meta D. Susana es ampliar su negocio y seguir surtiendo para ofrecer mayores  productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Susana is a dynamic and hardworking woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 53 years old and the mother of six children, all of which are older. She is involved in the sale of groceries and beverages. She has a grocery store in her house, and her husband works with her in this store. Susana has been a part of the “Las Solteritas” communal bank for the past six years. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which allowed her to invest in the purchase of beverages such as sodas, nectars, and juices.

Now, Susana needs a loan of 2300 PEN that will allow her to invest in products for her grocery store such as beverages, pasta, rice, sugar, oils, etc. Susana’s goal is to expand her business and to continue stocking to be able to offer more products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her grocery store such as sodas, pasta, rice, sugar, oils, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is fifty-three years old. She is a widow and mother of five children. Rose lives with her children in an old family house. She trades in palm oil and has been in business for five years. She buys the palm oil from the local manufacturers in towns and villages and resells these products to city dwellers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from palm fruits which has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish oil is skimmed off and reboiled to expel water content. Rose desires to use the loan to buy the palm oil in bulk. She would be able to supply more customers and improve her finances to support her children education.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil in bulk.

loans.name: Gloria Del Jesus

texts.es:
la sra. GLORIA DE JESUS C. se dedica a la compra de leche misma que procesa y hace varios derivados de la leche como ser: Queso, Cuajada, mantequilla, y requeson.
ella vive en unión Libre y su compañero de hogar se dedica a la agricultura (siembra de maíz y frijoles) ya que esta es una zona en donde se cosechan mas granos básicos.
del matrimonio tienen 3 hijos los cuales dependen un 100% de ellos.- La Sra. C., decidio dedicarse al negocio ya que la situación economica para ellos no era favorable. con su negocio le  va muy bien. con los ingresos que le genera su negocio ella cubre sus gastos personales, y colabora a su esposo a cubrir ciertos gastos del hogar.
estando ahi nos dio a probar el quesillo que ella procesa y tiene un muy buen sabor, fue muy agradable estar unos momentos con Gloria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria de Jesus C. is in the business producing dairy products such as cheese, cuajada, butter and requeson. She lives in domestic partnership, and her companion is in agriculture (corn and beans), as this region is known for growing grains. They have 3 children who depend on them 100 percent. Mrs. C. decided to pursue her business, as their financial situation was not favorable. Business has been going well, and with the income it generates she’s able to cover her personal expenses, and helps her husband with some of the household expenses. While we were there, she gave us a sample of the quesillo she makes and it was very tasty. It was a pleasure to spend some time with Gloria.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of milk for dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Akpéli

texts.fr: A. Akpéli est née en 1969 et vit à Agbokou, un quartier de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin depuis quarante deux ans. Akpéli est mariée à KOUTCHIKA Jean. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Les charges de la famille sont supportées à la fois par Akpéli et Jean. Akpéli n’a jamais été à l’école. C’est pourquoi, depuis trente ans déjà, Akpéli s’est livré à la vente de divers (piments, pâte alimentaire, conserves, sardine, poivre, etc.). Akpéli achète ses articles à IKpinlè et à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Akpéli vend ses produits à la devanture de son domicile. Akpéli est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà obtenu deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Afin d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’accroitre davantage son activité, Akpéli sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Akpéli was born in 1969 and has been living for 42 years in Agbokou, a district of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to KOUTCHIKA Jean. The couple has two children who are both in school. Family expenses are covered by Akpéli and Jean together. Akpéli has never attended school. This is why, for 30 years now, she has given herself to selling various goods (chili peppers, pasta, canned foods, sardines, black pepper, etc.) She buys these goods in IKpinlè and in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She sells them at the entry to her home. Akpéli is a former ALIDé client who has obtained two loans before, which have been repaid. In order to increase her working capital and to grow her business further, she’s requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of items (pasta, canned foods, sardines, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Lita

texts.es: Lita es una mujer dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 41 años, madre de dos hijos menores de edad, se dedica a la venta de naranjas, mandarinas, toronjas y limones, ella trabaja junto con su esposo, el negocio lo tienen en el mercado de Bellavista de esta localidad. Es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Ucayalinas” desde hace dos años. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en telas, para coser blusas y venderlos, ahora Lita necesita un crédito de 2000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar  frutas al por mayor y posteriormente comercializarlas. La meta de Lita es tener una fuente de soda, y aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Lita is a dynamic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, which is in the region of Ucayali. Lita is 41 years old and the mother of two dependent children. She sells oranges, tangerines, grapefruits, and lemons. She and her husband work together at their business located in the market at Bellavista.

Lita has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Ucayalinas” for two years. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles, which was used to buy fabric for making blouses that she sold herself. She is now requesting a loan of 2000 soles to purchase fruit in bulk to sell later at the market.

Lita’s goal is to open a soda fountain so that she can increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit in bulk

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a single parent with one child, who is currently in school. She started off in business two years ago and now she is 26 years old. She enjoys sales, the business through which she makes a living. Dorothy is hard-working and makes use of any market opportunity to make money. She sells ladies' dressing bags and purse. She also fries pastries.

With the loan, Dorothy wants to include the sale of ladies' shoes and slippers. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her child’s education. She believes in your support and would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase flour, oil and other ingredients.

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr: Z. Monique est née en 1969 et réside au quartier Agbokou à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, depuis dix ans. Mariée à GOHOUN Joseph, un peintre, Monique est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Monique n’a jamais été à l’école. Depuis une vingtaine d’année, Monique vend de la nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce de tomate, du poisson frit, de l’œuf ou de la viande) à Agbokou. Monique s’approvisionne au marché Oundo à Porto-Novo. Monique est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Afin d’agrandir son activité et d’augmenter sa clientèle, Monique sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Z. Monique was born in 1969 and has been residing for ten years in the Agbokou district of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of the Republic of Benin.  She is married to GOHOUN Joseph, a painter, and is the mother of three children who are all in school.  The couple jointly provides for the family.  Monique has never been to school.  For some 20 years in Agbokou, she has been selling food (rice served with sauces made with tomatoes, fried fish, eggs, or meat).  She supplies herself at the Oundo market in Porto-Novo. Monique is a former ALIDé client having already benefited from two loans, which have been repaid.  In order to expand her business and to increase her customer base, she's requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and containers of peanut oil

loans.name: Melita

texts.es: Melita es una mujer  perseverante y trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarinacocha región de Ucayali, tiene 37 años, es madre de cinco hijos, uno de ellos mayor de edad. Melita se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso, ella vende en su casa, cuenta  con el apoyo de su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Gotitas de Amor” desde hace ocho meses. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 500 soles, que lo utilizó para comprar gaseosas, yogures y néctares, en la actualidad Melita necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar ropa de segundo uso. La meta de Melita es tener una tienda de artículos de abarrotes y pasamanería.
texts.en:
Melita is a persistent and hardworking woman. She lives in the district of Yarinacocha, which is in the region of Ucayali. Melita is 37 years old and the mother of 5 children, of whom 1 is already an adult. She sells secondhand clothing out of her home and has the support of her husband.

Melita joined the Communal Bank “Gotitas de Amor” (Droplets of Love) eight months ago. Her first loan of 500 soles was used to buy soft drinks, yogurts, and nectars. She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy more secondhand clothing. Melita’s goal is to open her own clothing store and sewing workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase secondhand clothing

loans.name: María

texts.es: María Rodríguez es una socia dinámica y trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarinacocha región de Ucayali, tiene 37 años, madre de un hijo. María se dedica a la crianza  y venta de pollos, ella cuenta con un galpón para la crianza, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la comercialización de tablas. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Gotitas de amor” desde hace ocho meses. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en pollos para vender en el mercado, ahora necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado en la compra de alimentos balanceados para pollos, para luego comercializados.
texts.en:
María Rodríguez is one of our dynamic and hardworking members. She lives in the district of Yarinacocha in Ucayali region. María raises and sells chickens. She has a barn that houses her birds. Her husband is a lumber merchant and provides her with his full support.

She joined the Communal Bank “Gotitas de Amor” (Droplets of Love) eight months ago. María used her first loan of 300 soles to purchase chickens to sell at the market. She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy feed for her birds, which she will sell at a later time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for her chickens

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is forty-seven years old. She is married and the mother of four children. She lives with her family in their own house. She operates a pharmaceutical shop and sells various kinds of medicine like blood tonics, pain killers, malaria drugs, etc. in her neighborhood. Many local people patronize her drugstore for first aid and cure when they are sick.

Emelia has time for every customer that visits her shop. She usually enquires about the symptoms of the illness to offer the right medicine and also gives advice on its usage. She has been in operation for the past twelve years and has assisted in the cure of a number of common diseases such malaria, cholera, typhoid ,etc. in her community.

She requests the loan to top up her working capital to purchase more medicines to serve her community and in the process raise more income to support her family. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To procure assorted pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Mereñita

texts.es:
Mereñita  es una socia dinámica y emprendedora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 48 años, madre D. cuatro hijos todos mayores D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes al por menor, también alquila motocarro, ella se encuentra muchos años separada, pero siempre se dedico a trabajar arduamente para salir adelante. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “ Ricardo Palma” desD. hace cuatro años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles, que invirtió en gaseosas para vender.
Con este crédito D. 1000 soles, le permitirá invertir en productos para su tienda (arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, etc.). La meta D. Mereñita es tener su negocio bien implementado y crecer en sus finanzas.
texts.en:
Mereñita is one of our dynamic and enterprising members. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in Ucayali region. Mereñita is 48 years old and the mother of four adult children. She has a retail store where she sells groceries as well as a motor taxi that she offers for rental. Mereñita has been separated for many years, but she always worked hard in order to get ahead.

She joined the Ricardo Palma Communal Bank four years ago. Mereñita used her first loan of 300 soles to buy sodas to sell. She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles to acquire products for her store (rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.). Her goal is to manage her business well and grow financially.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.

loans.name: Carla Priscila

texts.es:
Carla es una socia con muchos anhelos de superación, es dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 27 años, es madre de un niño, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso y también tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, negocio que tiene en su casa, es madre soltera que ha salido adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Innovadoras ll” desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de yogurt para vender.
Con este crédito de 1700 soles, comprará ropa de segundo uso y otra parte la invertirá en productos de primera necesidad para su bodega. La meta de Carla es tener una tienda de prendas de vestir y accesorios.
texts.en:
Carla is one of our dynamic members who has high hopes for self-improvement. She is 27 years old, the mother of one child, and lives in the city of Pucallpa. Carla sells secondhand clothing and also manages a small grocery store out of her home. Being a single mother, Carla has expended much effort in order to get ahead.

She joined the Communal Bank “Las Innovadoras II” (The Innovators II) two years ago. Her first loan of 300 was used to buy yogurt to sell. Carla is now requesting a loan of 1700 soles to buy secondhand clothing and basic consumer products for her store. Her goal is to open another store where she sells clothing and accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase secondhand clothing & basic consumer products for her store

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra es una socia trabajadora y dinámica, vive en el distrito de Yarinacocha, región de Ucayali, tiene 42 años, es madre de dos hijos mayores de edad. Sandra se dedica a la compra y venta de madera(listones, tablas, tucos) negocio que lleva a cabo con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Gotitas de Amor” desde hace ocho meses, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 500 soles que lo invirtió en la compra de  productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos), en la actualidad Sandra necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar madera en el puerto para posteriormente vender. La meta de Sandra es tener una fuente de soda.
texts.en:
Sandra is one of our dynamic and hardworking members. She lives in the district of Yarinacocha in Ucayali region. She is 42 years old and the mother of two adult children. Sandra buys and sells wood (strips, boards, and planks) and manages her business alongside her husband.

She joined the Communal Bank “Gotitas de Amor” (Droplets of Love) eight months ago. Sandra used her first loan of 500 soles to buy basic necessities (rice, sugar, milk, and noodles). She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles to acquire wood at the port for resale. Her goal is to open a soda fountain.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood in bulk

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.es:
Celedonio tiene 30 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y alegre, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. Para Celedonio los días de trabajo comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, cuando junto a su motocarro sale en busca de pasajeros para transportar, él es muy atento con sus pasajeros y siempre está pendiente de ellos, ya que desea darles muy buen servicio, para cuando lo vean de nuevo tomen otra vez su motocarro.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es manejar por la calles de Juliaca, ya que se distrae mucho haciéndolo, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche. Con el tiempo, espera poder juntar el dinero necesario para comprar un nuevo motocarro.

Este es el 5to préstamo de Celedonio con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querido por el resto de socias. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará nuevas llantas para su motocarro, ya que las que tiene actualmente están gastadas por el arduo trabajo.
texts.en:
Celedonio, 30, is a very hard-working and happy man. He lives in his own house, and what he wants most of all is to be successful in life. Celedonio’s work days begin very early in the morning when he leaves with his “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) to look for passengers to transport. He is very attentive with his customers, and he always takes care of them. He wants to give them very good service so that when they see him again they will take his “motocarro”. What he likes best about his work is driving the streets of Juliaca. He finds it very entertaining. He has been doing this for five years. The most difficult part is having to work the late hours at night. In time, he hopes to be able to get together enough money to buy a new “motocarro”. This is Celedenio’s fifth loan with MFP. He feels responsible about paying it back on time. He does not want to cause problems for the members of his communal bank where he is very dear to the other members. He will use the 1,000 PEN that he is asking for to buy tires for his “motocarro”. The ones he has now are worn out from the hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new tires

loans.name: Yermi

texts.es:
Yermi es una mujer dinámica, vive en  Pucallpa región Ucayali tiene 38 años, es madre de cinco hijos, de los cuales tres son mayores de edad, Yermi se dedica al alquiler de motocarro, negocio que comparte con su esposo para salir adelante. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Ricardo Palma” desde hace cinco años. El  primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles, que le permitió invertir en golosinas y gaseosas.
Con este crédito de 1000 soles, comprará un motor nuevo para su motocarro. La meta de Yermi es llegar a tener una tienda de repuestos y lubricante para motos y motocarro.
texts.en:
Yermi is a dynamic woman who lives in Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. She is 38 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are adults. Yermi rents out a motorcar (motorcycle taxi) and manages this business with her husband in order to get ahead.

She joined the Ricardo Palma Communal Bank five years ago. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase candy and sodas. Yermi is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy a new engine for her motorcar. Her goal is to open a retail store that sells spare parts and lubricants for motorcycles and motorcars.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new engine for her motorcar

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Here is Issa G., a farmer and businessman. Issa is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 from Kiva lenders through SMT for the first time to invest in his farm and business. He will use the loan to pay labor and buy seeds.

Issa is thirty-two years old; he is married to a businesswoman and they have four children who are attending junior secondary and primary schools respectively. Issa was born in the village of Massampa in northern Sierra Leone.

loans.use: Invest in his farm by buying seeds and paying for labour

loans.name: Camila

texts.es: Camila es una socia perseverante y muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 28 años, es madre de un pequeño, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, este negocio funciona en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la venta de pescado en el puerto de la ciudad. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Loreto” desde hace dos años, el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de 300 soles  que le permitió  invertir en golosinas para vender, en la actualidad Camila necesita un préstamo de 2800 soles que será utilizado para comprar sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche, jabón, aceites y otros productos de primera necesidad para vender. La meta de Camila es tener una tienda bien surtida y comprarse su casita.
texts.en:
Camila is a persevering, hardworking member who lives in Pucallpa city in the Ucayali region. She is 28 years old and the mother of a young son. She sells groceries from her house. Camila is supported by her husband, who sells fish in the city's port. She has been part of the "Loreto" community bank for two years. The first loan she received was for 300 PEN, which enabled her to invest in candy to sell. Currently, Camila needs a loan of 2,800 PEN that will be used to buy sacks of rice and sugar, cartons of milk, soap, oil and other basic goods for the store. Camila's goal is to have a well-stocked store and to one day buy a house.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice and sugar, cartons of milk, soap, oil, etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Victoria is twenty-eight years old. She is divorced and has four kids who are currently in junior high and primary schools. Victoria lives with her children in an old family house. She trades in palm oil. She has been in business for five years. Her husband is a farmer.

She buys the palm oil from the local manufacturers in towns and villages and resells it to city dwellers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from palm fruits which have been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (the oil) is skimmed off and reboiled to expel water content. Victoria desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying the palm oil in bulk to be able to supply it to more customers and improve her finances.

loans.use: To buy palm oil in bulk.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor, de 30 años, es una mujer muy alegre y luchadora, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. El trabajo de Leonor es la venta de helados, junto a su inseparable carrito recorre las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca en busca de personas que deseen refrescarse con un delicioso helado, ella es una vendedora muy alegre y carismática, por lo cual siempre tiene más clientes que su competencia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiende para encargarse de su negocio así como de las tareas del hogar, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes, ya que esto la cansa mucho. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera poder juntar el dinero necesario para poner una tienda de helados.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Leonor con MFP y espera tener la misma puntualidad que tuvo en sus primeros créditos, pues en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y solidaria. Con los mil quinientos soles solicitados planea incrementar su capital de trabajo, para así poder comprar más helados.
texts.en:
Leonor, 30, is a fighter and a very happy woman. She lives in the house that she inherited from her parents. She is determined to work very hard to succeed in life. Leonor sells ice cream. Together with her inseparable cart, she travels the streets of the city of Juliaca looking for people who want to refresh themselves with a delicious ice cream. She is a happy and charismatic salesperson. That is why she always has more customers than her competition. What she likes most about her work is the freedom she has to run her business and do her household chores. She has been doing this for four years. The most difficult part is walking all day looking for customers. It makes her very tired. In the future she hopes to be able to get enough money together to have an ice cream store. This is Leonor’s fourth loan with MFP. She expects to be as punctual as she was with her first loans. She is a very responsible and supportive member of her communal bank. She will use the 1,500 PEN she is asking for to buy more ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
R. es una socia trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 59 años, es madre D. cuatro hijos, todos mayores D. edad. R. se dedica a la venta D. artículos D. pasamanería (artículos D. uso doméstico), venD. en una mesa en la vereda D. su casa (ambulante). Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Ucayalinas” desD. hace cuatro años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue D. 300 soles, que fue utilizado para comprar adornos para el cabello, correas para niñas.
Actualmente R. necesita un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles, monto que será utilizado para comprar artículos variados D. pasamanería para vender. La meta D. R. es tener un puesto en el mercado para vender mas y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
R. is a hardworking, active member who lives in Pucallpa city, in the Ucayali region. She is 59 years old and mother of 4 grown children. R. sells decorative trimmings (such as tassels or fringe used for furniture or curtains) from a table on the sidewalk in front of her house. She has been part of "Las Ucayalinas" community bank for 4 years. The first loan she received was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy girls' hair adornments. She now needs a loan of 1,000 PEN, which will be used to buy various items used as trimming. R.'s goals is to have a market stand to sell more and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase items used as decorative trimming.

loans.name: Mosses

texts.en: Mosses T. is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to invest in his business. Mosses bakes and sells breads. He has been doing this business for ten years now. With this loan, he will be able to buy ingredients like bags of flour and sugar. Mosses was born in Mayossoh village in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have ten children.

loans.use: Buy bags of flour and sugar

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una mujer dinámica y perseverante, vive en el distrito de Manantay-Ucayali, tiene 26 años, es madre de dos niños, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de madera, actividad que realiza con su esposo. Liliana forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Ucayalinas” desde hace un año y ocho meses, donde siempre se a caracterizado por su puntualidad. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que fue utilizado para invertir en yogur y gaseosas para vender.
Con este crédito de 1500 soles, comprará madera la misma que será aserrada para posteriormente venderla. La meta de Liliana es tener una fuente de soda y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Liliana is dynamic and persevering, she lives in the Manantay-Ucayali district. She is 26-years old and the mother of 2 children. She works with her husband, buying and selling wood. Lilian has been part of "Las Ucayalinas" community bank for 1 year and 8 months; she is known for being punctual. The first loan she received was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy yogurt and soft drinks to sell. With this loan of 1,500 PEN she will buy wood, which will be cut and sold. Liliana's goal is to own a soda fountain and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood wholesale.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is 32 years old. She is married with four children, and currently, all her children are in school. Yaa enjoys sales, the business through which she makes money to support her family. She works very hard with the passion of providing brighter future opportunities for her children. She is a petty trader who has been selling bananas and local salt for ten years now.

Yaa buys bananas from villages and retails them to her customers at a profit. With the loan, she wants to inject more capital into her business to buy stock in bulk.

Being able to buy in bulk is advantageous because it is a hedge against price hikes and also helps avoid frequent travel to fill demand. She hopes to use part of her profit to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase banana and salt in bulk.

loans.name: Zoila María

texts.es:
Zoila es una mujer  dinámica, vive en el distrito de Manantay región de Ucayali, tiene 42 años, es madre de seis hijos, de los cuales tres son mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, chupetes, hielos, néctares y también vende productos de belleza por catálogo, ella es madre soltera, que siempre ha salido adelante con sus hijos pese a las dificultades que ha pasado. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Claritas 2” desde hace un año y ocho meses. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que le permitió invertir en productos para la venta de menús (comida).
Actualmente Zoila necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será utilizado para invertir una parte en bebidas y otra parte en indumos para la venta de salchipapas. La meta de Zoila es llegar a tener un restaurante y seguir incrementado su negocio.
texts.en:
Zoila is a dynamic woman. She lives in the Manantay district in the region of Ucayali. She is 42 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom are adults. She works selling soda, juices, popsicles, and ice cream. She also sells beauty products by catalogue. She is a single mother, but has always perservered with her children despite the difficulties they have faced. She has been part of the Community Bank Las Claritas 2 for a year and eight months. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which allowed her to buy products in order to sell meals. Now, Zoila needs a loan of 1000 soles which will be used to purchase drinks and the products necessary to make salchipapas (potatoes with sausage). Zoila's goal is to eventually run a restaurant and continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks and supplies to make fast food

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is forty-two years old. She is married and the mother of four kids who are in junior high and basic school. Faustina’s husband works as a farmer. Faustina and her family live in a family house.

Faustina sells personal products and cloth. She buys cosmetics and personal products such as earrings, beads, powder, assorted pomades, make-up, etc and cloth from a nearby city and sells her goods in the market square in her community. She says she also treks to nearby markets to sell through door-to-door sales. She has been in this business for five years now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can purchase cosmetics in bulk.

She believes the loan assistance will enable her to reach out to other market centers and eventually, help improve her family finances.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Genith

texts.es:
Genith es una socia activa y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 31 años, es madre de tres hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogos, su esposo es obrero. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Solteritas” desde hace dos años, ella empezó con un crédito de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en colonias y talcos para bebes.
Ahora necesita un crédito de 1500 soles que será invertido en la compra de productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas, talcos, y otros, para luego ser vendidos a sus clientes. La meta de Genith es llegar a tener un bazar bien surtido y salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Genith is an active and persevering businesswoman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, located in the Ucayali region. She is 31 years old and has three young children. She sells beauty products through catalogs and her husband is a laborer. She has been affiliated with the communal bank, “Las Solteritas” (The Young Single Women) for the past two years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN (~$100 US) which she used to invest in colognes and baby powders. She needs a loan for 1,500 PEN ($525 US) which she will invest in other beauty products, such as perfumes, creams, talcs, and other products which she will sell to her customers. Genith’s goal is to have a good selection of products in order to advance her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in beauty products for resale

loans.name: Lily

texts.es:
Lily es una mujer emprendedora, vive en el distrito de Yarinacocha, región de Ucayali, tiene 36 años, es madre de tres hijos menores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado, actividad que lo realiza junto con su esposo, cuenta con un motocarro pues les sirve de transporte para vender por diferentes lugares del distrito. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Gotitas de Amor” desde hace ocho meses, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 500 soles, que le permitió invertir en la compra de pescado fresco y seco para vender.
Con este crédito de 1200 soles comprará otro motocarro para alquilarlo. La meta de Lily es construir su casa y tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Lily is an enterprising woman who lives in the town of Yarinacocha, located in the Ucayali region. She is 36 years old and the mother of three young children. She and her husband sell fresh fish and depend on a motorized cart to transport their wares, which they sell in various locations around their district. She’s been working with the communal bank, “Gotitas de Amor” (Drops of Love) for the past eight months. Her first loan was for 500 PEN (~$175 US), which allowed her to invest in fresh and dried fish for resale. She will use this loan of 1,200 PEN ($425 US) to invest in another motorized cart which she will rent out. Lily’s goal is to build her home from where she can also run a small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a motorized cart to rent out

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira es una mujer emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 35 años, es madre de tres hijos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de helados, adoquines (hielo con frutas), yogurt, este negocio lo realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es mecánico de maquinaria pesada. Ella  es una de las integrantes del Banco Comunal “Las Innovadoras ll “ desde hace un año. Elvira empezó con crédito de 300 soles, que lo invirtió en yogurt para vender, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, que será utilizado para comprar una congeladora y de esta manera tener mas espacio para colocar sus productos. La meta de Elvira es llegar a tener una fuente de soda y seguir trabajando para lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Elvira is an enterprising woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucalayi region. She is 35, and she has three grown children. She sells ice cream, “adoquines” (ice with fruit), and yogurt. Her business is in her house. She counts on her husband’s support. He is a heavy machinery mechanic. She has been a member of the Las Innovadoras II Communal Bank for one year. Elvira started with a loan for 300 PEN, which she used to buy yogurt to sell. She now needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy a freezer. This way she will have more space for her products. Elvira’s goal is to have a soda fountain and to keep working to achieve her objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is 50 years old. She is divorced and the mother of four children with two currently pursuing education in primary school. She lives with her children in an old family house. She sells plantain, rice, maize and groundnuts in the community market. She buys her goods from the farmers in the surrounding villages. She has been in business for four years. She wants a loan to buy stock in bulk so that she can cut down on costs such as the frequent trips to procure her supplies. Akosua wants to maximize her profits to support her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuff in bulk.

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles V. Muñoz es una señora de 51 años, vecina de Los Tijos de Upala, localizado en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural  con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi montañosa ubicada en Costa Rica, Centroamérica.  La comunidad se dedica especialmente a la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería. Vive con su esposo y dos de sus hijos.

Desde hace 2 años doña María se dedica a la siembra de papaya, por lo tanto, dice que posee bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivo, tiene un pequeño  terreno en el cual ha sembrado papaya anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirla por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita doña María es un micro crédito de ¢680,000 (seiscientos ochenta mil colones), para comprar fertilizantes, semillas, y diferentes insumos para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su cosecha, así al final podrá ser recompensada y podrá tener una muy buena producción. 

Doña María forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Los Tijos, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  su segundo crédito y dice que con el espera seguir creciendo como microempresaria y sacar su negocio adelante. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles V. Muñoz is 51 years old and a resident of Los Tijos de Upala, which is located in Alajuela province. She lives with her husband and two children. Her rural community lies within the semi-mountainous topography of Costa Rica in Central America. The main industry in the community is centered on agriculture, especially the cultivation of grains, and livestock breeding to a lesser extent.

For two years, Doña María has been cultivating papayas. She says she has enough experience in the care and maintenance of this type of crop. She has a small area designated for planting papaya and has achieved very good results harvesting and distributing her crops in previous seasons. Therefore, she wants to expand her plantation. Thanks to the success of her business, the quality of life for her family has improved considerably.

At the moment, Doña María is requesting a microloan of 680,000 colones to buy fertilizers, seeds, and different supplies in order to maintain and promote the growth of her crop with hopes of being rewarded by a good harvest.

Doña María is a member of the Community Credit Enterprise of Los Tijos, one of 100 partner organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her second loan and says that she hopes to continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur and move her business forward. She also thanks these types of organizations and credit facilitators who enable her to spend more time on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inputs & supplies for growing papaya

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is thirty-seven years old. She is a widow with three children. Currently, two of them are pursuing education in junior and primary schools. She lives together with her family in a family house. She works with zeal as a resourceful parent supporting her family and providing for the children's schooling. She is a fish monger and sells all kinds of fresh and smoked fish. She sells through “hawking” (door-to-door sales). She procures her goods from big time fish sellers at wholesale prices. She has been in business for five years. According to Akosua, most of her customers are food vendors in her community. 

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fishes in bulk to serve a larger market and eventually, help improve her family finances and support her children education.

loans.use: To purchase smoked fish in bulk.

loans.name: Manuel Albert

texts.en:
Our client is Manuel Albert.  He is part of a communal bank consisting of 16 neighbors who live in Cusco.  The group is called Santa Rosita de Lima, named after a religious icon, a virgin, in Peru.  He is a native of Cusco. He is 44 years old and is single.

Manual has a steady job working at a grocery store.  He will use this loan to fix up his home.  This is his first loan from Asociación Arariwa. Manual Albert appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To repair his home

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 42 years old, and is married with four children. Three of her children are currently in school while the other is learning a trade. Janet lives with her family in a rented apartment. She works hard to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops and all kinds of vegetables. Janet is a petty trader, selling beef, groundnuts, vegetable oil, etc. on a table top in the community market.

Janet wants to use her loan to buy a supply of beef, groundnuts, vegetable oil, and assorted spices, in bulk, in order to expand her business. She hopes to make a good income from her expanded business, enabling her and her husband to support their children's education.

loans.use: To purchase food stuffs (beef, groundnuts, vegetable oil, assorted spices) in bulk

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth H. V.  es una señora de 49 años de edad quien vive en una comunidad llamada Canalete localizada en Upala en la provincia de Alajuela, es un lugar semimontañoso y sus actividades económicas se centran en la agricultura y mayormente en la ganadería. Es una comunidad con una gran oportunidad de desarrollo y establecimiento de microempresas, tanto de agroindustria como  comercio

Desde hace 30 años que doña Elizabeth se dedica a la costura; pocos años después de  empezar en esto ella inició su propio negocio de confección de ropa. Ella elabora diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir que luego vende en negocios de la comunidad y sus alrededores o incluso la llegan a buscar a su casa. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente. 

Actualmente doña Elizabeth requiere un préstamo de ¢680.000 (seiscientos ochenta mil colones) para comprar materiales como telas, hilos, broches, botones etc. Con esta inversión espera poder incrementar su producción y mejorar la calidad de los  productos. Afirma que gracias a este préstamo podrá ofrecer más y mejores opciones para sus clientes actuales y potenciales.

Doña Elizabeth es socia  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Elizabeth H. V. is 49 years old and lives in the community of Canalete Upala, which is located in the Alajuela province. This region is a semi-mountainous area where the main business activities are agriculture and livestock breeding. It is a community that has great opportunity for development and establishment of micro-enterprises in both agribusiness and commercial trade.

For 30 years, Doña Elizabeth has been engaged in sewing. A few years after she learned how to sew, she started her own dressmaking business. She produces various types of clothing that she sells to businesses in the community and directly out of her home. Thanks to her micro-business, the living conditions for her family have improved considerably.

At the moment, Doña Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 680,000 colones to purchase materials such as fabric, thread, pins, buttons, etc. With this investment, she hopes to increase her production and improve the quality of her finished items. She says the loan will help her provide more and better options to her existing and prospective customers.

Doña Elizabeth is a member of the Community Credit Enterprise of Canalete, one of 100 partner organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she hopes to continue growing personally and financially. She is an active participant of her local credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Jamilatu

texts.en:
Jamilatu is 40 years old and married with six children, who are all in school. She owns and operates a grocery store, selling items such as rice, evaporated milk, canned food and drink, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soap, candies, biscuits, etc. in the local market.

Jamilatu wants to use her loan to buy a bulk supply of rice, canned food and drink, milk, assorted spices, washing soap and powder etc. to expand her business. She hopes to make a good income from her expanded business in order to provide her children with a good quality education.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 50 years old, single, and has three children and three grandchildren. She is a native of Cusco, Peru. Lucia is part of a communal bank consisting of 16 neighbors who live in Cusco. The group is called Santa Rosita de Lima, named after a virgin of Peru.

Lucia sells bedroom products, such as sheets, pillow cases, etc. that she buys from wholesalers in Cusco. She sells goods worth approximately 1,400 to 1,500 PEN each week, but the business is not steady. She will use her loan to buy more products to sell. Lucia appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more bedding products to sell

loans.name: Freda

texts.en: Freda is 45 years old and a married mother with three children. Her children are currently in school. Freda sells frozen foods in the local market to support her family.  She says demand for fish is high but she does not have sufficient operating capital to meet these demands. She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen foods like chicken, pork, beef, fishes to enable her raised enough income to support her children education.

loans.use: To purchase frozen foods in bulk.

loans.name: Sayra Esmelin

texts.es:
La sra Sayra Esmelin R. se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, cremas y otros productos de uso personal, syra necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor ya que asi tiene mayores ganancias, se esta preparando para la epoca de navidad ya que en esos dias las ventas son muy buenas y desea tener todo su producto a tiempo.
sayra tiene 37 años de edad, es muy simpatica, en su comunidad la aprecian mucho ya que es una gran persona.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz porque todo le esta saliendo bien y que desea superarse. fue muy grato estar un tiempo con Sayra.
texts.en:
Sra. Sayra Esmelin R. sells cleaning products, crèmes, and other personal products. She needs a loan so that she can buy more merchandise at wholesale and generate higher earnings. Sayra is preparing for the Christmas season when sales are better, so she wants to receive all of her products on time.

Sayra is 37 years old and has a cheerful disposition. Her community greatly appreciates that she is a great person. She told us that she is very happy that everything is going well and hopes to continue improving. It was a great pleasure to spend time with Sayra.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cleaning products, crèmes, deodorants, shampoos, liquid hand soaps, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is 28 years old. She is a single parent with one child. Her child is currently in school.  She is a hawker and has been hawking cosmetics like earrings, necklace, make ups, perfumes etc. in the neighborhood to her loyal clients. She says selling of cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make good income for the family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco Javier N. O. es un señor de 34 años de edad quien vive con su hijo de ocho años en una comunidad llamada Canalete localizada en Upala en la provincia de Alajuela, es un lugar semimontañoso y sus actividades económicas se centran en la agricultura y mayormente en la ganadería. Es una comunidad con una gran oportunidad de desarrollo y establecimiento de microempresas, tanto de agroindustria como  comercio

Desde hace poco mas de diez años que don Francisco se dedica a la ebanistería , pero fue hace aproximadamente un año que puso su propio negocio. Él construye muebles de diferentes diseños y para diferentes usos. Dice que desde que inicio el proyecto los resultados han sido buenos ya que ha tenido una gran aceptación en su comunidad y los ingresos que ha generado lo han ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.
 
En estos momentos lo que desea don Francisco es solicitar un préstamo  por ¢680,000 (seiscientos ochenta mil colones) para comprar una lijadora, una maquina canteadora y más madera entre otros materiales que necesita para la elaboración de los muebles. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar más ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida. 

Don Francisco es socio  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier N. O. is 34 years old and has been living in the community of Canalete for 8 years. Located in the province of Alajuela, the community lies in a semi-mountainous region where the main economic activities are agriculture and livestock breeding. It is a community that has great opportunity for development and establishment of micro-enterprises in both agribusiness and commercial trade.

For the past 10 years, Don Francisco has been dedicated to woodwork but only started his own business approximately one year ago. He builds furniture in different designs and for different uses. Since starting his business, he says the results have been good and his work is widely accepted in the community. The revenues he has generated have helped to support his family.

At the moment, Don Francisco is requesting a loan of 680,000 colones to buy a sander, an edging machine, wood, and other materials needed for making furniture. He hopes to continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur so that he can generate more income to improve his living conditions.

Don Francisco is a member of the Community Credit Enterprise of Canalete, one of 100 partner organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing personally and financially. He is an active participant of his local credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sander, an edging machine, and materials for making furniture

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita es una socia joven y dinámica, vive en la cuidad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 26 años, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos de carros, trae pedidos, trabaja junto a una prima que le envía los repuestos de la ciudad de Lima. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es chofer de autos. Anita forma parte del Banco Comunal “Rumbo al Éxito” desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en la compra de gaseosas, en la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 2000 soles, que será utilizado para la compra de repuestos de autos.  La meta de Anita es tener una tienda de repuestos de carro y seguir contribuyendo en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Anita is a young and dynamic member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 26 years old and the mother of two young children. She is engaged in the sale of automobile spare parts. She takes orders, working with a cousin who sends her the parts from the city of Lima. She counts on the support of her husband who works as a car driver.

Anita has been a member of the “Rumbo al Éxito” (Headed for Success) Communal Bank for one year. The first loan she received was for 300 soles that she invested in the purchase of soft drinks. Currently, she needs a loan of 2000 soles that will be used for the purchase of automobile spare parts. Anita’s goal is to have an auto parts shop and to continue contributing to family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Her loan will be used for the purchase of automobile spare parts

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 46 years old. She is divorced with three children. Her children are currently in school.  She is a trader and trades in cosmetics like earrings, make up, perfumes etc. in the neighborhood of her loyal clients. She says selling of cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income and meet the family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora is forty one years old. She is a single parent with three children who are in school. She is a serious minded business woman who works hard to support her children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc. She believes it is now an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase her stock of goods available for sale and make more income to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase assorted grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a forty two year old woman. She is a wife and the mother of six children who currently in school. She is a serious minded business woman who works hard to support her husband to provide for her family. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc. She deems it an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase her stock of goods available for sale and to make more income to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna Ordoñez B. es una señora de 39 años de edad quien vive con dos de sus cuatro hijos. La comunidad donde vive doña Mirna se llama Canalete localizada en Upala en la provincia de Alajuela, es un lugar semimontañoso y sus actividades económicas se centran en la agricultura y mayormente en la ganadería. Es una comunidad con una gran oportunidad de desarrollo y establecimiento de microempresas, tanto de agroindustria como  comercio.

Desde hace más de 18 años doña Mirna se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de granos básicos. Dice que el mercado para estos productos es muy bueno ya que es forman parte de los alimentos principales que se consumen en Costa Rica. Comenta que gracias a este proyecto sus condiciones de vida han mejorado considerablemente y dice además que ha crecido como persona y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento.

En estos momentos doña Mirna desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢450,000 (cuatrocientos cincuenta mil colones), para agrandar un poco más su siembra, darle mantenimiento, además comprar fertilizantes, semillas entre otros insumos. Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con productos de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto. 

Doña Mirna es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su cuarto  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Mirna Ordoñez B. is 39 years old and lives with two of her four children. The community where she resides is called Canalete and is located in the province of Alajuela. This region is a semi-mountainous area where the main business activities are agriculture and livestock breeding. It is a community that has great opportunity for development and establishment of micro-enterprises in both agribusiness and commercial trade.

Doña Mirna has been involved in agriculture for more than 18 years, specifically the cultivation of basic grains. She says the market of these products is very good because they are staples that are consumed throughout Costa Rica. Thanks to her business, her living conditions have improved considerably. Mirna also claims that she has grown as a person and has acquired much knowledge.

At the moment, she is requesting a microloan of 450,000 colones in order to increase her plantings slightly. Doña Mirna will also pay for maintenance and purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other supplies. Through this investment, she expects a good harvest and hopes her output will command a high market price.

Doña Mirna is a member of the Community Credit Enterprise of Canalete, one of 100 partner organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her fourth loan and she hopes to continue growing personally and financially. She is an active participant of her local credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for cultivating grain

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 36 years old and married with two children who are pursuing their education at primary school. She started trading three years ago. She enjoys trading and has lots of marketing experience. She trades in lingerie and assorted perfumes.  Emma wants to use the loan to buy more stock of lingerie and perfume. She hopes to use part of her profits to finance her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase lingerie and perfume in bulk.

loans.name: Yeni Xiomara

texts.es:
la sra. YENI XIOMARA P. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia, ella es madre soltera, el cual depende a un 100% de ella. Yeni inicio con una pequeña pulpería la cual le ha ayudado en gran manera para poder seguir adelante, tamabien vende cosmeticos y cuando sale a vender cosmeticos es su hijo quien le ayuda a vender en la pulpería la que dia a dia va creciendo, debido por la buena atención con que atiende a los clientes y por la buena adminsitración que le dan a la misma.
ella tiene  1 1/2 año de haber iniciado con la pulpería y durante este tiempo le ha ido muy bien ya que sus
condiciones de vida han mejorado.- ella manifesto sentirse muy contenta por estar saliendo adelante.
Yeni esta solicitando el credito para surtir mas el negocio el cual le generara mayores ventas y su utiliddes de igual manera aumentaran.
texts.en:
Yeni Xiomara P. sells popular consumer products. She has a general store. She is a single mother, so her children are 100% dependent on her. Yeni started with a small store, and that really helped her be able to get ahead. She also sells cosmetics. When she goes to sell cosmetics, her son helps her by selling in the store. The store is growing day by day because of the good attention she gives her customers and her good administration. She started the store a year and a half ago. During this time it has gone very well for her, and her living conditions have improved. She feels very happy to be getting ahead. Yeni is asking for a loan to stock her business, which will generate more sales and more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soap, shortening, oil, coffee, bread, crackers, butter, soft drinks, churros, preserves, toilet paper, pasta, salsas, and canned goods

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is fifty one years old. She is divorced and has four children. Currently, all her children are in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, and assorted cooking oils. She wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, and other items to expand her business. She believes that with increased income, she will be more capacitated to finance her children’s education and to provide them with life opportunities that are better than what she has had.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries in bulk

loans.name: Creciendo En Fe 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Felicia lives in Santo Domingo, the crowded capital of the Dominican Republic, where traffic jams and intense heat are unfortunately more reliable than electricity and running water. She is the group coordinator of Creciendo en Fe (Growing in Faith) and is looking forward to taking out her second loan with Esperanza International. 

Felicia sells clothes to local customers made up of  friends, family, neighbors, and whoever happens to walk buy and like what she is selling. With the loan she will buy 10 blouses, 6 pairs of men's pants, 12 pairs of women´s pants, 6 men´s polo shirts, and underwear to sell to her customers. With the money that is left after selling these and reinvesting into more merchandise, she is planning on buying shoes and clothes to comfortably dress her children. In the future she hopes to own a larger clothing store to help her on the way to this dream. Thank you for your generous support!

loans.use: To buy supplies of blouses, pants, underwear, polo shirts for resale.

loans.name: Respekte Lavi De Trou Du Nord Group

texts.en:
The “Respekte Lavi” or “Respect Life” of the Trou du Nord Group is a made of ten male and female entrepreneurs. After successfully repaying their 1S.loan, they are looking forward to continued success and growth in their businesses with their 2nd loan. Though small, the group has a wide range of businesses. Sony A. is president of the group. He is a young man of 24 years with no children

Sony buys blocks of special paper in the Dominican Republic to resell in various communities. The paper is often used to make receipts and wrap foods in the market.  He is thankful for the firS.loan because he was able to create a profit and help his family with the increased earnings. He hopes to be able to save enough to open a boutique from which to sell the paper as well as other necessities for businesses in the area. His prayers are that the individuals in his group may continue to learn from each other, to help everyone grow, and that Esperanza may become stronger and more beneficial to the community. On behalf of Sony, Respekte Lavi, and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy blocks of paper for business use

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia M. S. es una señora de 36 años de edad, quien vive en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Cuatro Bocas de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche) y agricultura. Ella vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo.

Desde hace ya varios años doña Sonia se dedica a la ganadería de doble propósito. Logra vender sus  productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de los productos que ofrece. Doña Sonia considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, ella y su familia han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida.

En estos momentos doña Sonia desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones), para comprar 5 vacas y así  poder incrementar la producción. Ella sabe que contar con mayor número de vacas más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser una microempresaria exitosa la motiva ha esforzarse con gran esmero y dedicación.

Doña Sonia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Bansuperafe; la cual está integrada solo por mujeres ya que se especializa en apoyar a mujeres no profesionales y  jefas de hogar, es una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Sonia M. S. is 36 years old and lives in a small Costa Rican rural community named Cuatro Bocas de Upala, which is located in the Alajuela province. It is known for its commerce, raising cattle for both beef and dairy and agriculture. She lives with her two children and her husband. For many years now, Doña Sonia has been dedicated to raising cattle for the production of both beef and dairy. She sells her goods to the neighbors in her community, who are very satisfied with the quality of the products she offers. Doña Sonia attributes the improved living conditions that she and her family have enjoyed to the progress of her business. Currently, Doña Sonia is requesting a loan of 500,000 colones so she may purchase 5 cows and increase her production. She realizes that having more cows means more sacrifice and hard work. However, her desire to be a successful entrepreneur is what drives her dedication and efforts. Doña Sonia is a member of Empresa de Crédito Communal Bansuperafe, which is made up only of women, as it specialty is supporting non-professional women and female heads of households. It is one of the 100 organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her third loan, with which she expects to continue her personal and economic growth, as well as actively participating in her community’s credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 5 cows

loans.name: Milagros De Cumyasa 4 Group

texts.en:
Lourdes is the coordinator of her group Milagros D. Cumyasa (Miracles of Cumyasa). Her story is representative of the members of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated from Haiti to the DR) clients more generally. Her group is based in Cumyasa an area near the town of La Romana where the economy centers around sugar cane and where both running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Here she makes her home with her husband and two children.

Lourdes is excited about requesting her second loan with Esperanza. She has successfully completed her first loan cycle. She plans to use this loan to invest in her colmado/bakery (small corner store) by purchasing five gallon jugs of clean water to sell and platters on which to serve the cakes she bakes. She believes that this will increase her business and the attractiveness of her product, helping her to realize larger profits. With these profits she plans to continue constructing her home and to save for her children to go to university.
