One of her long term goals is also to move her business to a place where there is more foot traffic and therefore more customers. She thanks you all for her support

loans.use: Bottles of water to sell and trays to present her cakes

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es:
Presidenta del B.E. RUBI: Doña Tomasa , vive en la populosa zona de la Av. Buenos Aires, en domicilio propio, tiene 47 años y esta casada con don Martin , su negocio es familiar ya que trabaja junto a su esposo en su taller de cerrajeria, la especialidad es la fabricacion de puertas y ventanas de metal; el crédito que obtuvo lo está destinando a la compra de herramientas.
Tesorera del B.E. RUBI: Doña Maria , vive en la popular zona de Alto Tacagua en casa familiar, tiene 42 años y está casada con don Braulio , la señora se dedica a la venta de calzados que los fabrica su esposo y ella es la que se dedica a venderlos en su puesto propio ubicado en la avenida Los Andes; El lo ha destinado para la compra de material como cuero, pvc y otros.

Secretaria del B.E. RUBI: La señora Gloria , vive en la zona central en casa de sus suegros, tiene 31 años de edad y se encuentra casada con don Efrain , su actividad económica está relacionada con la venta de videos, DVD, C; los mismos que los compra al por mayor del desaguadero (frontera con la republica del Peru)y los comercializa en la zona Norte de la ciudad de La Paz; el crédito lo está destinando al incremento de capital.
texts.en:
Doña Tomasa serves as president of the Rubi Communal Bank. She lives in her own home in the populated district of Av. Buenos Aires. She is 47 years old and married to Don Martin. Doña Tomasa and her husband operate a locksmith shop. Their specialty is manufacturing metal doors and windows. The loan she will receive will be used to purchase tools.

Doña Maria is the treasurer of the Rubi Communal Bank. She lives in the district of Alto Tacagua in her family home. Doña Maria is 42 years old and married to Don Braulio. From her vending booth on Los Andes Avenue, she sells shoes that her husband manufactures. Her loan will be used to purchase materials such as leather, vinyl, and other products.

Sra. Gloria is the secretary of the Rubi Communal Bank. She lives in the central district in the home of her in-laws. She is 31 years old and married to Don Efrain. Gloria sells videos and DVDs. She acquires her products from a wholesale outlet located on the Peruvian border and then sells them in the northern district of La Paz. Her loan will be used to increase her operating capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase merchandise & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: La Buena Fe , 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Yusleny is the coordinator of her group, L. Buena Fe (The good faith). Her story is representative of both her group members and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican Republic clients more generally. Her group is based in the areas surrounding L. Romana, a city where the economy is based around the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home with her husband and child.

Yusleny is excited about requesting her third loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her first two loans without incident. She plans to buy supplies of shoes, Avon beauty products (which are popular with her clients) and inexpensive jewelry. She plans to invest the profits from this activity in putting a new roof on her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy supplies of beauty products, shoes and jewelry

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana S. A., tiene la edad de 23 años, es soltera, y tiene un hijo que es su mayor prioridad. Ella quiere comprar fertilizante para darle mantenimiento a la siembra de maíz y frijoles que tiene en la finca. Además, su finca es de 18 hectáreas, y tiene gallinas, cerdos y pasto para vacas. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva.También, nos cuenta que ella ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales como lo es El Banco Nacional de Costa Rica, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella también tiene el deseo de brindarle a su hijo la educación necesaria a su hijo para que sea en el futuro una persona preparada  y pueda enfrentar de manera más fécil la vida.
texts.en:
Diana S. A. is 23 years old. She is single and has a son, who is her highest priority. She would like to buy fertilizer in order to maintain the corn and bean crops on her farm. Her farm is 18 hectares in size, and she also raises chickens, pigs and grass for cattle. She has worked on her farm for several years now, and she would like to expand it. This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any problems with her property, but she wants to make her farm more productive. She also tells us that she has taken out other loans with state banks, such as the National Bank of Costa Rica, but FUDECOSUR offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate. Diana also wants to provide her son with the education he will need to prepare for his future and face life more successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer for corn and bean crops

loans.name: Canal De Benedicion 4&5 Group

texts.en:
Solenny is the coordinator of her group, the Canal de Bendicion (Channel of Blessing). Her story is representative of both the members of her group and Esperanza's Dominican Republic and Haitian clients more generally. Her group is based the rural areas surrounding La Romana, an area where many Haitian immigrants labor in an economy based around the sugarcane harvest, and where electricity and running water (none of which is potable) are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home alone.

She is excited about requesting her third loan and expanding her business. She has repaid these loans without problems and her loan size has grown along with her business. She plans to use this loan to purchase more pants and sheets to sell in her community. By buying in bulk she can negotiate a better price and use those profits to further invest in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy supplies of sheets and pants

loans.name: María

texts.es: María es una socia dinámica y muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 37 años, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad, se dedica a la venta de menús (comida), pues tiene un restaurante, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. María forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Soñadoras ll” desde hace cuatro años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 500 soles, que invirtió en prendas de vestir para vender. Ahora necesita un crédito de 3000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar productos (verduras, fideos, arroz, azúcar, leche) para su negocio de menús. La meta de María es construir cuartos para ponerlos en alquiler.
texts.en:
María is a hard-working and dynamic member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 37, and she has two minor children. She sells prepared food; she has a restaurant. She counts on her husband’s help. María has been part of the Mujeres Soñadoras II Communal Bank for four years. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used to buy clothes to sell. Now she needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy products (vegetables, noodles, rice, sugar, milk) for her prepared food business. María’s goal is to build rooms to put up for rent.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies (vegetables, noodles, rice, sugar, milk) for her prepared food business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali,  tiene 42 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, pues tiene una bodega en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Soñadoras ll” desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que lo utilizó en la compra de bebidas.
Actualmente ella requiere un crédito de 1500 soles que será utilizado para comprar abarrotes (fideos, azúcar, detergente, leche, etc.) y surtir su negocio. La meta de Milagros es tener una tienda mas grande y seguir adelante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Milargros is a hard-working and dynamic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 42. She sells general groceries; she has a convenience store in her house. She has been part of the Mujeres Soñadoras II for three years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy drinks. She currently needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy groceries (noodles, sugar, detergent, milk, etc.) to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Celia Del Pilar

texts.es:
Celia es una socia trabajadora y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 45 años, se dedica a la venta de jugos, ella vende todos los días desde muy temprano, su kiosco se encuentra instalado en la vereda de su casa, ella es madre de dos hijos mayores de edad. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Soñadoras Il” desde hace cuatro años, donde siempre se ha caracterizado por su dinamismo y puntualidad, El primer crédito que recibió fue de 500 soles, que fue utilizado para comprar productos de belleza para vender.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 3000 soles para comprar vasos, jarras para su negocio de venta de jugos.  La otra parte la utilizará para comprar joyas, negocio en el que piensa incursionar.
La meta de Celia es tener un local para su juguería mas grande e implementarlo para la atención de más clientes.
texts.en:
Celia is a hardworking and optimistic member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 45 years old and she sells juices. She sells juices beginning early every day. Her kiosk is located on the sidewalk to her house. She is the mother of two older children. She has been a member of the “Mujeres Soñadoras II” communal bank for the past four years, where she is noted for her dynamism and punctuality. The first loan that she received was for 500 PEN, which was used to purchase beauty products to sell.

She currently needs a loan of 3000 PEN to purchase cups and pitchers for her juice selling business. She will use the other part of the loan to purchase jewelry, a business which she plans to enter.

Celia’s goal is to have a bigger place for her juice bar and set it up to be able to attend to more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cups and pitchers, and to purchase silver jewelry to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es una mujer trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 63 años de edad, es madre de cinco hijos, todos mayores, se dedica a la venta de menús (comida), forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Soñadoras ll” desde hace dos años.  El primer crédito fue de 300 soles que invirtió en insumos para la venta de menús (comida). 
Este crédito de 1200 nuevos soles, piensa invertirlo en construcción y reparación de los dormitorios de su casa. Su meta es seguir trabajando e implementar su venta de menús.
texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 63 years old and is the mother of five children, all of which are older. She sells à la carte meals and has been a part of the “Mujeres Soñadoras II” communal bank for the past two years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she invested in ingredients for her à la carte meals to sell.

Josefina plans to invest this loan of 1200 PEN in the construction and repair of the bedrooms in her house. Her goal is to continue working and to set up her à la carte menu sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the construction and repair of the bedrooms in her house.

loans.name: Rocío Del Pilar

texts.es: Rocío del Pilar es una socia dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 33 años, es madre de tres hijos, uno mayor de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de panes, galletas y gaseosas, actividad que realiza desde su casa, cuenta del apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la venta de tablas (madera). Rocío forma parte del Banco Comunal “Rumbo al Éxito “ desde hace dos años. El primer crédito que recibió fue para invertir en gaseosas para vender, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 2300 soles, que será utilizado para comprar panes, galletas y gaseosas que luego venderá.  La otra parte será para la compra de madera para fabricar una pequeña tienda, ya que Rocío vende sus productos en un triciclo en forma ambulatoria. La meta de Rocío es tener una tienda bien surtida de abarrotes en general
texts.en:
Rocío del Pilar is a dynamic member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 33 years old and is the mother of three children, one of which is older. She is involved in the sale of breads, cookies, and sodas, which she sells from her home. She has the support of her husband, who sells wood planks. Rocío has been a member of the “Rumbo al Éxito” (Bound for Success) communal bank for the past two years. The first loan that she received was to invest in sodas to sell.

Now, Rocío needs a loan of 2300 PEN, which will be used to purchase breads, cookies, and sodas that she will then sell. The other part of the loan will be for the purchase of wood to build a small store, since Rocío currently sells her products door to door from a tricycle.

Rocío’s goal is to have a well-assorted general grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products (breads, cookies, sodas) and to buy wood to build a store

loans.name: Mujeres De Las Colinas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres de las Colinas” se formó en base a ala necesidad de generar más ingresos de sus integrantes  para tratar de mejorar su calidad de vida.
Utilizaran el crédito para diversas opciones de compra como ser: compra de insumos para la fabricación de comestibles, compra de leche azúcar, yerba, harina, sal panificados y verduras para su posterior venta, compra de ropas de ocasión para su posterior  venta, compra-venta de calzados, compra-venta de productos cárnicos, compra-venta de lácteos, compra-venta de huevos etc., para tratar de aumentar los ingresos y aliviar la pobreza. 
Las integrantes que conforman este comité realizan las siguientes actividades:
Alberta C. 	Manicurista 
Catalina O. 	Venta de  mercería                                                                                                                                   
Mercedes R.	Venta de bijouterie
Diana B.	Venta de comestibles
Angelica D.	Venta de comestibles 
Ramona V.	Venta de lencerías
Maria Elvira A.  	Venta de cd´s  
Liz C.	Venta de comestibles
Norma C.	Venta de ensalada de frutas y Venta d verduras. 
Susana  M.	Venta de comestibles
Tomasa  Z.	Venta de cd´s
Ubaldina E.	Venta de bebidas
Virginia G.	Venta de comestibles
Elvira  L.	Venta de comestibles y bebidas
Fulvia F.	Elaboración y venta de artesanías
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres de las Colinas" was formed to generate more income for its members to try to improve their quality of life.

They will use the loan for various purchases like: buying ingredients to make food; buying milk, sugar, yerba, flour, salt, baked goods, and vegetables to sell; buying second-hand clothing to sell; buying and selling shoes, meat, dairy products, eggs, etc. to try to increase their incomes and lessen their poverty.

The members who make up this group do the following jobs:

Alberta C. Manicurist Catalina O. Sells sewing notions Mercedes R. Sells jewelry Diana B. Sells food Angelica D. Sells food Ramona V. Sells underwear Maria Elvira A. Sells cds Liz C. Sells food Norma C. Sells fruit salad and vegetables Susana M. Sells food Tomasa Z. Sells cds Ubaldina E. Sells beverages Virginia G. Sells food Elvira L. Sells food and drinks Fulvia F. Makes and sells handcrafts

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, yerba, oil, baked goods, meat, cassava, sweet potatos, fruit, and cds to sell

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.es: Peregrina es una mujer trabajadora y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 44 años, madre de cinco hijos, todos mayores de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y bebidas al por menor, su bodega funciona en su propia casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Rumbo al Éxito” desde hace un año. El primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que fue invertido en la compra de gaseosas para vender, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1700 soles, que será utilizado para la compra de productos (arroz, azúcar, fideos, gaseosas, detergente, etc) para la venta en su bodega. La meta de Peregrina es ampliar y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Peregrina is a hard-working and optimistic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 44 years old and mother to five children, all of whom are older. She is dedicated to selling groceries and drinks at retail prices. Her shop operates out of her home. She has been part of the "Rumbo al Exito" (Path to Success) Community Bank for a year. The first loan that she obtained was for 300 soles which was invested in the purchase of sodas to sell. Now, she needs a loan of 1,700 soles which will be used to buy products (rice, sugar, noodles, sodas, detergent, etc.) to sell in her shop. Peregrina's goal is to expand and stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles, sodas, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Oumou Khaïry

texts.fr: 36 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, Oumou Khaïry B. est membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE CENTRE depuis 1 an et demi. Elle vend du poisson frais au niveau du marché de son quartier et les bénéfices qu'elle réalise lui permettent d'assurer la prise en charge partielle des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
A 36-year-old mother with three children, Oumou Khaïry B. has been a member of Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE CENTRE for 1½ years.  She sells fresh fish at the market in her area. And the profits she earns allow her to ensure that some of her family's needs are met. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her small business

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia es una mujer dinámica y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 43 años, es madre de tres hijos, de los cuales dos son mayores de edad. Felicia se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas refrescantes, actividad que realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a vender cebiche (comida típica). Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres del 2000” desde hace seis años, el primer crédito que recibió fue 300 soles que invirtió en la compra de golosinas, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar una vitrina y también golosinas.
texts.en:
Felicia is a dynamic and optimistic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 43 years old and is mother to three children, of whom two are adults. Felicia is dedicated to selling candy and refreshments, an activity that she conducts from her home. She is supported by her husband who is dedicated to selling "cebiche" (a typical food.) She has been part of the "Mujeres del 2000" (Woman of 2000) Community Bank for six years.The first loan that she received was for 300 soles which she invested in the purchase of candy. Now, she needs a loan of 1,000 soles which will be used to buy a glass case and also candy.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a glass case and also candy for her business.

loans.name: La Flor Group

texts.es:
el grupo denominado la flor esta ubicado en el barrio altos de la flor de la ciudad de San Lorenzo,  esta conformado por tres miembros quienes ya tienen mucho tiempo de estar trabajando juntos y tienen el deseo de mejorar sus negocios. a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

el señor Roque N. N. es casado, tiene 52 años de edad y se dedica al comercio, tiene una 
pulperia hace 6 años donde trabaja junto con su esposa. Tiene la intencion de surtir su negocio con nuevos productos.
 
el señor Jose Rafael B. O. es casado y tiene 42 años de edad, se dedica a la venta
de sal al por mayor en la ciudad de San Lorenzo y en otras localidades.
ahorita el desea comprar la sal a un precio barato y una cantidad grande ya que dentro de poco el precio va a subir y asi tendra mejores ganancias.

la señora Maria Victorina M. B. tiene 55 años de edad y se dedica a la venta 
de nacatamales, leña y tortillas.  ella vende estos productos en su casa de habitacion, esta ocupacion le ha servido para mejorar su nivel de vida, necesita invertir el credito en compra de leña y maiz  aprovechando la temporada  de cocecha ya que el precio esta bajo, de esta manera 
tendra un porcntaje mas de ganancia.
texts.en:
The group called "La Flor" (The Flower) is located in the Altos de la Flor neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo. It is made of three members who have been working together for a long time, and who all want to improve their businesses. These are the details of the businesses of the three members:

Mr. Roque N. N. is married. He is 52 years old, and has a business. He has had a grocery store for six years, where he works with his wife. He would like to stock his business with new products.

Mr. Jose Rafael B. O. is married and 42 years old. He sells salt wholesale in the city of San Lorenzo and other places. Right now, he wants to buy a large amount of salt at a low price, because the price is going to rise soon, and this way he will earn a better profit.

Mrs. Maria Victorina M. B. is 55 years old, and sells Nicaraguan tamales, firewood, and tortillas. She sells these products from her home, and this occupation has helped her improve her quality of life. She needs to invest her loan in buying firewood and corn, taking advantage of the harvest season because prices are lower, so that she can earn a better profit.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, firewood, pasta, rice, chicken, milk, salt

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Silvia María

texts.es:
Silvia María es una mujer dinámica y perseverante, vive en el distrito D. Manantay región D. Ucayali, tiene 49 años, es madre D. tres hijos D. los cuales uno es mayor D. edad, el cual la apoya, ya que ella es separada desD. hace mucho años del padre D. sus hijos.
Se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes al por menor, tiene su bodega en su casa y también se dedica a la crianza y venta D. pollos. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al 2000” desD. hace ocho años, donD. siempre ha demostrado ser una socia puntual. El primer crédito que recibió fue para invertir en artículos para su bodega.  En la actualidad Silvia necesita un crédito D. 3000 soles, con el cual comprará productos para su bodega (arroz, detergente, leche, azúcar, etc.) y alimento balanceado para pollos. La meta D. Silvia es tener un locutorio ya que su casa se encuentra ubicado lejos del centro D. la cuidad y las personas no tienen mucho acceso a la comunicación telefónica.
texts.en:
Silvia María is a dynamic and persevering woman. She lives in the district of Manantay in the Ucayali region. She is 49 years old and is mother to three children, one of whom is adult and supports her since she has been separated from the father of her children for many years. She is dedicated to selling groceries at retail prices. She has a shop in her home and she is also dedicated to raising and selling chickens. She has been a member of the "Mujeres al 2000" Community Bank for eight years, where she has always demonstrated that she is a punctual member. The first loan that she received was to invest in items for her shop. Currently, Silvia needs a loan of 3,000 soles with which she will purchase products for her store (rice, detergent, milk, sugar, etc.) and balanced feed for her chickens. Silvia's goal is to have a phone store since her house is located far from the center of the city and people do not have a lot of access to telephone communication.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for her store and balanced feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Georgina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Georgina está integrado por Georgina de los Ángeles P., Vilma del Socorro Z.  M. y Heydi Raquel H. G.. 

La señora P. de 36 años vende tomates en el Mercado de Masaya, los tomates son un producto hortícola de consumo nacional. Z. M. tiene año y medio vendiendo ropa interior en Granada y H. G. desde hace un año vende ropa y zapatos ambulante.

Ellas desean poder seguir trabajando e ir aumentado su mercancía, venta y ganancia.
texts.en:
The Georgina group includes Georgina de los Ángeles P., Vilma del Socorro Z. M., and Heydi Raquel H. G..

Mrs. P., ,who is 36 years old, sells tomatoes in the market in Masaya, since tomatoes are a product that is eaten nation-wide. Ms. Z. M. has been selling underwear for a year and a half in Granada, and Ms. H. G. has been traveling and selling clothing and shoes for a year.

They want to continue working and to continue increasing their merchandise, sales, and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tomatoes

loans.name: Alida

texts.es: Alida es una mujer trabajadora y optimista, vive en el distrito D. Manatay, región D. Ucayali, tiene 40 años, es madre D. cinco hijos D. los cuales cuatro son mayores D. edad. Alida se dedica al alquiler D. motocarro (transporte), cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que se dedica a la venta D. tablas (madera). Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Victoriosas” desD. hace un año,  el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que fue utilizado en la compra D. gaseosas para vender en su casa, ahora ella necesita un crédito D. 1000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar madera, ya que Alida quiere construir cuartos para poner en alquiler. La meta D. Alida es  tener una bodega bien surtida D. productos y progresar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Alida is a hard-working and optimistic woman. She lives in the Manatay district, Ucayali region. She is 40 years old and mother of 5, four of whom are already of age. Alida works renting a motorcar (transportation). She can count with the support of her husband who sells wood planks. She has been part of the communal bank "Las Victoriosas" (the victorious) for a year. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which she used to buy soft drinks to sell in her home. She now needs a loan for 1000 soles, which will be used to buy wood, since Alida wants to build rooms to offer for rent. Alida's goal is to have a well stocked grocery store and to make progress in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying wood to build rooms for rental

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara es una socia emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 30 años y es madre de un niño. Sara se dedica a la compra y venta de prendas de vestir, ella trae de la cuidad de Lima esta mercadería, tiene una cartera de clientes a los que vende a crédito y cobra diariamente, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo pues ambos comparten los gastos del hogar. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Solteritas” desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que lo utilizo para comprar polos, en la actualidad Sara necesita un crédito de 2300 soles que será utilizado para comprar prendas de vestir para damas. La meta de Sara es llegar a tener una boutique y seguir trabajando para progresar.
texts.en:
Sara is an entrepreneuring member . She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 30 years old and mother of a boy. Sara works buying and selling clothing. She brings this merchandise to the city of Lima. She has a client list to whom she sells on credit and who pay her daily. She counts with the support of her husband because they both share in the household expenses. She has been part of the communal bank "Las Solteritas" (the single ladies) for two years. The first loan she was given was for 300 soles, which she used to buy polo shirts. Currently, Sara needs a loan for 2300 soles, which she will use to invest in women's clothing. Sara's goal is to have a boutique and keep working in order to progress..

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying women's clothing

loans.name: Aïssatou Combé

texts.fr: Aïssatou Combé, 55 ans, mariée, 8 enfant en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE depuis 7 ans. Avec son crédit elle développe une activité de vente de poisson séché. Elle participe à la prise en charge quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en:
Aïssatou Combé, aged 55, is married and has eight children to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE for seven years.  With her loan, she's developing a business selling dried fish.  She participates in covering day-to-day family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To advance her small business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es una mujer emprendedora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 59 años, es madre de dos hijos mayores de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y alquiler de motocarro, actividad que realiza junto con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres del 2000” desde hace nueve años, siempre es considerada socia puntual y optimista. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en colonias, talco y lápiz labial, en la actualidad Mercedes necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar productos de belleza y otra parte será para comprar repuestos para el mantenimiento de su motocarro. La meta de Mercedes es llegar a tener una tienda de lubricante y repuestos de motos y motocarro.
texts.en:
Mercedes is an entrepreneuring and active woman who lives in the city Pucallpa, region of Ucayali. She is 59 years old, mother of two children already of age. She works selling beauty products and renting a motorcar, which she does together with her husband. She has been part of the communal bank "Mujeres del 2000" (Women of 2000) for nine years, and has always been a punctual and optimistic member. The first loan that she received was for 300 soles which allowed her to invest in cologne, perfumed talcum, and lipstick. Currently, Mercedes needs a loan for 1000 soles which she will use to buy beauty products and another part to buy spare parts for her motorcar's maintenance. Mercedes' goal is to have a store of spare parts and oil for motorcycles and motorcars.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying beauty products and spare parts for her motorcar's upkeep

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana Patricia O. S. de 35 años tiene cuatro años de dedicarse al comerció de cerdo. Esta es una actividad común en la familia nicaragüense y una alternativa económica para ayudar a generar ingresos a la familia.

Ella cría, destaza y produce alimentos del cerdo como es el nacatamal, el frito, la moronga y el chicharro entre otros. Tiene dos años de trabajar con Adim en los cuales ha sentido que le ayudado mucho a solucionar su economía y a manejar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Patricia O. S., who is 35 years old, has been raising and selling pigs for 4 years. This is a common activity for Nicaraguan families, and is an economic alternative that helps earn money for her family.

She raises and butchers pigs, and makes food like Nicaraguan tamales, fried pork, blood sausage, and pork rinds. She has been working with ADIM for two years, and she feels that they have helped her take care of her finances and manage her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 69 años, es madre de ocho hijos, todos mayores de edad. Nelly se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso, ella vende su mercadería en varias comunidades cercanas a la ciudad, esta muchos años separada del padre de sus hijos y siempre ha salido adelante. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” desde hace ocho años, El primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que invirtió en la compra de pescado seco para vender en el mercado.
Con este crédito de 1300 soles, piensa invertir en la compra de ropa de segundo uso. La meta de Nelly es llegar a tener una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
texts.en:
Nelly is a hardworking and dynamic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 69 years old and is mother of eight, all of them of age. Nelly works selling used clothing. She sells her merchandise in several communities close to the city. She has been separated from the father of her children for many years and has always been able to get ahead. She has been part of the communal bank "Mujeres Valientes" (Brave Women) for eight years. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she invested in buying dried fish to sell at the market. With this loan for 1300 soles, she plans to invest in second-hand clothing. Nelly's goal is to own a grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: This loan will allow her to invest in used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plants, seeds, planters, soil, fertilizer

loans.name: Alida

texts.es:
Alida es una joven dinámica y trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región de Ucayali, tiene 20 años, es madre de un niño. Ella se dedica al alquiler de motocarro (transporte), actividad que comparte con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Victoriosas” desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que utilizó para invertir en frutas y utensilios para la venta de jugos, ella antes tenia este negocio.
Con este crédito de 1500 soles, piensa comprar un motocarro de segundo uso. La meta de Alida es tener una tienda de repuestos y lubricante de motos y motocarro.
texts.en:
Alida is a dynamic and hardworking young woman. She lives in the district of Manantay, Ucayali region. She is 20 years old, mother of a boy. She works renting a motorcar (transportation), activity which she shares with her husband. She has been part of the communal bank, "Las Victoriosas" (the victorious women) for two years. The first loan she obtained was for 300 soles, which she used to invest in fruit and utensils for the sale of juices; she used to have that business before. With this loan of 1500 soles, she plans to buy a second-hand motorcar. Alida's goal is to own store that sells spare parts and oil for motorcycles and motorcars.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying a second-hand motorcar

loans.name: Lili

texts.es: Lili es una socia trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 48 años, es madre de seis hijos, de los cuales cuatros son mayores de edad, ella es madre soltera, que se esfuerza por salir adelante y brindar un futuro mejor a sus hijos. Lili se dedica a la venta de bebidas y golosinas, actividad que lo realiza en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Solteritas” desde hace cinco años. El primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de golosinas para vender en su casa, ahora Lili necesita un crédito de 1500 soles que será utilizado para comprar mercadería como prendas de vestir y zapatos para vender en su casa. La meta de Lili es  tener una tienda de todo tipo de artículos  para el hogar.
texts.en:
Lili is a hard-working and active member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. She is 48 years old and is mother to six children, of whom four are adults. She is a single mother who works hard to get ahead and provide a better future for her children. Lili is dedicated to selling drinks and candy, an activity that she conducts from her home. She has been a member of "Las Solteritas" (The Single Ladies) Community Bank for five years. The first loan that she obtained was for 300 soles which she used for the purchase of candy to sell in her home. Now, Lili needs a loan of 1,500 soles which will be used to purchase merchandise such as clothing and shoes to sell from her home. Lili's goal is to have a shop selling all types of items for the home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Fatima De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Fátima P. de 52 años de edad, vive en Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua,  con tres hijos mayores y que gracias Adiós logro criar sola sin la ayuda de su padre, se dedica  a la venta de ropa usada el cual vende mucho por bonita, barata y accesible de precios, con los prestamos ha logrado comprar mas pacas,  y la atracción de muchos mas clientes, sus planes es poder mejorar su casa y ayudar a sus hijos. Sus deseos es poder tener una tienda  el cual no pierde las esperanzas. Con este préstamo comprara pacas para aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Fátima P., 52, lives in Laureles Norte in the capital of Managua with her three adult children. She thanks God that she was able to raise them without help from their father. She sells used clothes. She sells a lot because they are pretty, cheap, and the prices are accessible. With loans she has been able to buy more bundles of clothes and attract many more customers. Her plans are to be able to improve her house and to help her children. She wishes to be able to have a store; she does not give up hope. She will use this loan to buy bundles of clothes to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a bundle of clothes to increase her inventory

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es: María  es una mujer dinámica y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 29 años, es madre de dos niños, ella se dedica al alquiler de motocarro (transporte), ya que este negocio le genera  un ingreso diario, también se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, en este negocio trabaja  junto a su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Innovadoras” desde hace seis años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que lo invirtió en la compra de bebidas como gaseosas, refrescos, para vender en su casa, ahora María necesita un crédito de 1500 soles, que será utilizado, una parte para el mantenimiento del motocarro y otra parte será utilizado en la compra de alimentos balanceado para pollos que posteriormente serán vendidos en el mercado de Bellavista de esta localidad. La meta de María es tener un local propio en el mercado para la venta de pollos y seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a dynamic and persevering woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 29 years old and is the mother of two children. She makes a living renting out a motorcycle taxi (for transport), since this business generates a daily income for her; she also raises and sells chickens, and works in that business with her husband. She has been a member of “Las Innovadoras” (“The Innovative Women”) Communal Bank for six years. For her first loan she received 300 soles, which she invested in the purchase of soft drinks and other beverages to sell at her home. Now María is requesting a loan of 1500 soles, which will be used in part for maintenance on her motorcycle taxi and in part for the purchase of balanced feed for her chickens; her chickens will later be sold in the Bellavista market in Pucallpa. María’s goal is to have her own stall in the market for selling chickens and to get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance on her motorcycle taxi and purchasing balanced feed for chickens

loans.name: Nery

texts.es: Nery es una socia dinámica y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 32 años, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad, Nery se dedica a la venta de frutas de esta región en el mercado de Bellavista,  cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la compra y venta de cacao. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Victoriosas” desde hace un año y seis meses, el primer préstamo que recibió de este banco fue de 300 soles, que fue utilizado en la compra de limones y naranjas.  Ahora Nery necesita un crédito de 1200 que será utilizado en la compra de diferentes frutas regionales. La meta de Nery es llegar a tener una tienda de abarrotes y seguir apoyando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Nery is a dynamic and optimistic member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 32 and has two minor children. Nery sells regional fruit in the Bellavista market. She has the support of her husband who buys and sells cacao. She has been part of the Las Victoriosas Communal bank for one year and six months. The first loan that she received from this bank was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy lemons and oranges. Now Nery needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy different regional fruit. Nery’s goal is to have a grocery store and to keep helping her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different regional fruit

loans.name: María Estefita

texts.es: María  Estefita es una mujer activa y trabajadora, vive en el caserío Señor de los Milagros que se encuentra ubicado en el kilómetro 21 carretera de Torna vista en el distrito de Campo verde región  de Ucayali, tiene 51 años de, madre de 8 hijos, todos mayores de edad. María se dedica a la crianza de pollos para luego venderlos en el mercado de su localidad, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mi Señor de los Milagros” desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 500 soles que invirtió una parte en el transporte de sus pollos al mercado y otra parte invirtió en pollitos para criar y venderlos posteriormente, en la actualidad María necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado en la compra de alimentos balanceados para aves. La meta de María Estefita es tener una tienda de abarrotes bien surtido y seguir apoyando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
María Estefita is an active and hard-working woman. She lives in the Caserió Señor de los Milagros, which is located on kilometer 21 of the Torna highway in the Campo Verde district of the Ucayali region. She is 51 and has eight grown children. She raises chickens to later sell in the local market. She has the support of her husband who is a farmer. She has been part of the Mi Señor de los Milagros Communal Bank for one year. The first loan that she received was for 500 PEN. She used part of it to transport her chickens to the market. She used the other part to buy chicks to raise and later sell. She currently needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy balanced bird feed. María Estefita’s goal is to have a well stocked grocery store and to keep helping her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy balanced bird feed

loans.name: Errol

texts.en: Errol R. V. is 45 years old, is in a common-law relationship and has no children. He wants to buy merchandise that he can then sell in his small store. He has been in this business for many years and would like to expand. He also owns a farm, where he grows coffee. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he has not had any loans with any other banks in the past. He wants to grow his business and farm, to do this he has to buy clothing for resale and fertilizers for the farm land to improve the crop harvest. This loan will allow him to provide a safer home for any children that he might have in the future.

loans.use: To buy supplies of store stock and fertilizer for coffee fields

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer trabajadora, vive en la cuidad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali, tiene 50 años, es madre D. ocho hijos, todos mayores D. edad. Victoria se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en general, tiene una tienda en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días D. la semana, también venD. salchipollo (comida rápida) por las noches, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se desempeña como profesor en una escuela primaria. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Loreto” desD. hace ocho años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en gaseosas, refrescos y  yogurt.
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito D. 1000 soles, para comprar artículos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, fideos y otros productos mas para vender. La meta D. Victoria es ampliar su negocio y  vender también artículos D. ferretería.
texts.en:
Victoria is a very hard-working woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 50 and has eight grown children. Victoria sells general groceries. She has a store in her house. She works in the store every day of the week. She also sells “salchipollo” (a fast food dish with chicken) in the evenings. She has her husband’s support. He is a teacher in an elementary school. She has been part of the Loreto Communal Bank for eight years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which allowed her to buy soft drinks and yogurt. She currently needs a loan for 1,000 to buy articles like rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, and other products to sell. Victoria’s goal is to expand her business and also sell hardware.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, and others

loans.name: Ruiseñor Group

texts.es:
María Iliana S. A. hace dos años y ocho meses que comenzó haciendo paletas con la ayuda de su nuera. Luego consiguió un frízer y empezó a comercializar los productos Eskimo en diferentes presentaciones. 

Eskimo un empresa nicaragüense que elabora productos lácteos diversos, tales como helados, sorbetes, leche y sus derivados. Es la mayor compañía heladera fundada en 1942 y que tiene presencia en todo el país. 

S. invertirá el crédito para adquirir más variedad de productos y en un futuro desea que sea convertir su negocio en una sorveteria completa, contar con un local, mesas y tazas entre otros.

Martha Lorena P. vende tortillas, frijoles cosidos y nacatamales estos son de consumo diario para los nicaragüenses y su meta es llegar a vender desayunos y almuerzos.

Xochi Raquel M. R. tiene pulpería y fritanga. La fritanga es un restaurante popular por excelencia en Nicaragua. Este consiste en la venta de alimentos fritos, que están preparados solo para poner en la parrilla, por lo generar se compra para la cena. Estos suelen ser carne asada, pollo frito, tajadas con queso, pollo asado, enchiladas, chancho con yuca……etc.
texts.en:
María Iliana S. A. started making popsicles two years and eight months ago with the help of her daughter-in-law. Then she got a freezer and started to sell different types of Eskimo products. Eskimo is a Nicaraguan company that makes diverse dairy products like ice cream, sorbet, milk, and its derivatives. It is the largest ice cream company, which was founded in 1942, and it is has a presence in the whole country. S. will use the loan to get a greater variety of products. In the future she wishes to convert her business into a complete sorbet shop. She wants to have a place with tables and cups among other things. Martha Lorena P. sells tortillas, cooked beans, and “nacatamales” (a traditional Central American dish similar to a tamale), which the Nicaraguans eat daily. Her goal is to sell breakfasts and lunches. Xochi Raquel M. R. has a mini-market and a “fritanga” stand. A “fritanga” is restaurant that is popular in Nicaragua for its excellence. It consists of selling fried foods that are prepared soley to be put on the grill. Generally, you buy them for dinner. They can be made of roasted meat, fried chicken, cheese slices, roasted chicken, enchiladas, and pork with yucca…etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ice cream, popsicles, sorbets, and cones

loans.name: Martina De La Concepcion

texts.es: Martina de la Concepción tiene 50 años, no es la primera vez que Martina ha realizado financiamiento con Fundación León 2000, por lo que siempre ha expresado que le ha sido de gran ayuda con su negocio. Su actividad económica es ofrecer el servicio de costura, hace mas de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que se ha ganado la fama de de ser la mejor costurera de su cuadra ya la mayoría de vecinos acuden a ella. A pesar de los problemas que enfrento con su esposo que la abandono y tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijos sin su apoyo. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de tela, zipper, hilos y tijeras. Su deseo es tener su propio taller de costura para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Martina de la Concepción is 50 years old. This is not the first time she has requested a loan from Fundación León 2000. She says the loans that she has received have always been very helpful to her business.

Martina has been dedicated to her sewing business for more than 11 years. She has earned a reputation for being the best seamstress on her block and most of her neighbors bring their business to her. Despite the problems she faced when her husband abandoned her, Martina has managed to raise her children without his support.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to purchase fabric, zippers, thread, and scissors. She hopes to open her own sewing workshop so that she can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, zippers, thread, and scissors

loans.name: Arely Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Arely de 42 años de edad, tiene una pulpería que desde hace seis años administra y desde horas temprana se levanta para atender a sus clientes en la mañana que es cuando se vende mas ya que muchas familias compran a diario para hacer el desayuno a su familias. El cual inicio con préstamo y unos pocos ahorros, madre soltera de dos hijos que los tiene estudiando,  vive en Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua. Sus planes es mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios. Con este préstamo comprara granos básicos, carnes, gaseosas, golosinas, lácteos y otros mas para subir las ventas y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña Arely is 42 years old and has been managing her own grocery store for 6 years. She wakes up in the early hours so that she can attend to her customers. Most of her sales are made in the mornings because many families come by every day to purchase the items they need for breakfast. Arely was able to start her business with the help of a loan and a small portion of her savings. She is a single mother of two school-aged children. She and her family live in Laureles Norte in the capital of Managua.

Arely has plans to make improvements to her home and support her children’s education. With this loan, she plans to buy basic grains, meat, sodas, candy, dairy products, and other items so that she can increase her sales and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, meat, sodas, candy, dairy products, and other items

loans.name: The Eden Group

texts.es:
el grupo el Eden son mujeres muy trabajadoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ellas se caracterizan por ser humildes, a continuacion se detalla cada una de las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
la sra. MARIA ELIBERTA I. M. se dedica al comercio, tiene una pulperia desde hace varios años atras.
este negocio es su unica fuente de ingresos, Maria necesita el credito para poder surtir mas su negocio ya que en estos momentos no tiene mucha variedad de productos. desea tener bien surtida su pulperia para dar una mejor atencion a sus clientes.
 
la sra. MARIA MAGDALENA BETANCURTH La principal y única fuente de ingresos es su pulperia que tiene 05 años de tenerla, su negocio esta ubicado en la colonia Morazán de la ciudad de san Lorenzo.
ella necesita el credito para surtir mas su negocio.

la sra. Maria Patrocinia G. tiene una pulperia que le a ayudado a salir adelante,  tiene varios años de tener su negocio, durante este tiempo sus condiciones de vida han mejorado. ella solicita el credito para ampliar y surtir mas su negocio.

todas ellas necesitan el credito para sacar adelante sus negocios y sus familias. el negocio de la pulperia es muy comun en nuestro pais, ya que muchas personas montan un negocio de estos para ganarse la vida, ademas que es facil de administrar y provechoso para muchas mujeres que tienen hijos pequeños, ya que la mayoria de estos negocios son en sus casas de habitacion asi trabajan y cuidan a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The women of the Eden Group are hardworking and eager to succeed. They are known for their humility and engage in different business activities.

Sra. Maria Eliberta I. M. started selling groceries several years ago. This business is her only source of income. Maria needs a loan so that she can restock her business because she does not carry a wide variety of products at the moment. She wants her store to be well-stocked so that she can provide better service to her customers.

Sra. Maria Magdalena Betancurth also manages a grocery store as her only source of income. She has been in business for 5 years. Her store is located in the Morazán subdivision of the city of San Lorenzo. She will use her loan to restock her business.

Sra. Maria Patrocinia G. has a grocery store that has enabled her to get ahead. She has been in business for several years and her living conditions improved during this time. She is requesting a loan to expand and restock her business.

These women need their loans to move their businesses and their families forward. Grocery stores are very common in Honduras, so many people start this type of business to earn a living. They are easy to manage and convenient for women who have young children. Most grocery owners run their businesses out of a room in their homes so that they can work and take care of their children at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock their stores

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Isolda Adilia

texts.es: La joven Isolda de 25 años de edad, vende granos básicos, frutas, verduras, golosinas,  desde hace dos años, el cual inicio con dinero que su mama le envió desde España para que se ayudara y pudiera tener sus propios ingresos, reside en Villa Venezuela en la capital de Managua, junto a su familia sus hijos son dos de 5 y 7 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como electricista, sus planes para el negocio es hacer el local mas grande, con este préstamo comprara mercadería variada para vender mas, como: granos básicos, lácteos, frutas y verduras. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible incrementar su negocio lo cual le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Isolda is a young woman who is 25 years old. She sells basic grains, fruit, vegetables, and candy. Isolda started her business two years ago when her mother sent her money from Spain in order to help her generate her own income. She lives in the neighborhood of Villa Venezuela in the capital of Managua. Her husband works as an electrician and they have two children, ages 7 and 5.

Isolda has plans to expand her business. With this loan, she will buy a variety of merchandise to increase her sales such as basic grains, dairy products, fruit, and vegetables. She thanks the Institution for making it possible to grow her business and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, dairy products, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Flor De Sacuanjoche Group

texts.es:
El grupo Flor de Sacuanjoche está conformado por María Danelia T. quien desde el 2003 tiene una tienda de ropa en su casa, Maritza Sánchez C. hace diez años comenzó con  su pequeña venta la cual ha ido creciendo con el tiempo y Mayra R. G. desde de hace tres años tiene un pequeño taller de zapatería.

Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios y esperan en un futuro ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Group “Flor de Sacuanjoche” consists of María Danelia T. who has been operating a clothing store from home since 2003; Maritza Sánchez C. who began a small sales operation 10 years ago and has grown over time; and Mayra R. G. who has been managing a small shoe store for 3 years.

They will invest their loan in their respective businesses and hope to expand in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Bilma

texts.es:
Bilma es una mujer de 42 años, está casada con Miguel; su pareja de toda la vida, quien tiene 60 año; y con él tiene un hijo (Jesús), de 14 años, que es el orgullo de ambos.
Ella anhela reaperturar su tienda de comestibles, que en otrora tenía en su casa,  ya que hace 3 años tuvo que cerrarla por motivos personales. Bilma recuerda cuando tenía su tienda y atendía amablemente a sus vecinos y le era muy rentable, ahora piensa volver a su negocio y hacerlo mejor que antes, con mayor cantidad de productos y con instalaciones más amplias. Con este negocio en su casa podrá obtener mejores ganancias económicas y no descuidaría a su familia, que es su mayor preocupación.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y desde ya planea cancelar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que tiene grandes sueños por cumplir y solo serán realidad si ella es responsable. Para concretar sus sueños está solicitando este crédito, y con él implementará su tienda para lograr de nuevo atender a sus clientes y ganar dinero para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Bilma is 42 years old and married to Miguel, her partner in life who is 60 years old. They have a 14 year old son Jesús, who is their pride and joy.

She longs to reopen the grocery store she managed out of her home. Three years ago, she had to shut it down for personal reasons. When she had her shop, Bilma remembers having to kindly attend to her neighbors and generating decent profits. Looking back, she believes she can do better than before by offering more products and providing better facilities. Since her business is in her home, Bilma believes she can generate better earnings without neglecting her family, which is a major concern of hers.

This is her second loan with MFP. Bilma already plans to make her payments on time because she has big dreams to fulfill and can only do so if she is responsible. To make her dreams reality, she will use the loan she requested to reopen her store and get back to serving customers. She hopes to generate an income so that she can help her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reopen her grocery store

loans.name: Osimir Jacinto

texts.es: El señor Osimir Jacinto tiene 53 años de edad, El se dedica a la venta  de queso y crema desde hace 7 años, por lo que tiene venta en su propia vivienda. El se levanta muy temprano todos los días por lo que tiene que recorrer muchos lugares para ofrecer su producto. Ya que esta es la principal fuente de ingreso de su hogar, es este el motivo que lo incita a realizarle mejoras a su pequeño negocio. Su mayor anhelo es mantener en funcionamiento su negocio y que Dios le de salud, en estos precisos momentos está necesitado de un financiamiento, que le permita comprar los materiales que le mantienen la actividad de su trabajo. su deseo es mejorar su vivienda y mejorar cada día en si negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Osimir Jacinto is 53 years old. He has been selling cheese and cream out of his home for 7 years. Osimir wakes up early every day because he has to deliver his products to several different places. Since this is the main source of income for his household, he is motivated to make improvements to his small business. His greatest hope is to continue operating his business and that God provides him with good health.

At the moment, Osimir is requesting a loan to purchase materials that will keep his business running. He desires to make repairs to his home and improve each day in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Faatali

texts.en:
Faatali P. is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Satapuala. She is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Faatali owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting taro for sale. Faatali has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 680 WST a month from these activities.

Faatali joined Kiva partner SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,700 WST from SPBD. This loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Faatali is now requesting a new loan of 2,450 WST, which will also be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be her third from SPBD. Faatali plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

Faatali was not affected by the tsunami which hit Samoa on 9/29/09.

About SPBD
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Elga

texts.es:
Elga es una persona muy alegre, tiene 38 años y comparte su vida con su esposo y sus dos hijos en su acogedora casa, la cual gracias a sus esfuerzos es propia. Ella ha sido educada en un hogar lleno de amor, lo cual ha trascendido actualmente, ya que ahora al conformar su propia familia les brinda todo lo que sus padres le enseñaron y dieron; es así que llena de cariño a sus hijos y esposo, quienes son su adoración. Ella se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de productos de belleza, ya que tiene grandes cualidades para convencer a la gente, pues es muy carismática. Además de ello, vende lencería fina, la cual ofrece a sus amigas y parientes obteniendo buenos ingresos gracias a su vitalidad, pues cuando realiza su trabajo piensa que debe realizarlo de la mejor manera como todo lo que emprende.

En un futuro, Elga quiere mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio, ya que éste le permite dedicarse a su hogar y a sus hijos, además de estar cerca de su madre, de la cual siempre está pendiente ya que es su fuente de inspiración.

Este en su primer préstamo con MFP y nos dice que al igual que su madre, ella piensa que la responsabilidad es lo más importante así que no tiene problemas con la puntualidad en los pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita mejorará su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de productos de belleza y lencería para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Elga is a cheerful person who is 38 years old and spends her life with her husband and their two children. Thanks to their efforts, her family owns their cozy home. Elga grew up in a household filled with love, which now transcends to her own family in which she tries to share everything her parents taught her. As a result, she adores her children and her husband and showers them with full affection.

Elga has been selling beauty products for the past 2 years. Due to her charismatic personality, she has become good in convincing people to buy her merchandise. In addition, she sells lingerie and offers her products to friends and relatives. Thanks to her vitality and attitude to strive for the best in everything she does, Elga has been able to generate good earnings. In the future, she would like to improve and expand her business. This would allows her to spend more time at home being a mother to her children, who serve as her inspiration.

This is Elga’s first loan with MFP. She tells us that, like her mother, she believes that responsibility is the most important quality. Therefore, she should not have any problems making payments on time. With the money she is requesting, she will improve her business by purchasing a large quantity of beauty products and lingerie so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of beauty products & lingerie

loans.name: Tafaoga

texts.en: Tafaoga F. is a 27-year-old woman living in the town of Eva. She is single and does not have any children. Tafaoga owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 450 WST a month. Tafaoga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Tafaoga is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 3rd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. Tafaoga was not affected by the tsunami which hit Samoa on 29th September 2009. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena tiene 57 años de edad, reside en el barrio Monseñor Lezcano en la capital de Managua, con dos hijos que procreo los cuales están mayores de edad, su negocio es una pulpería  con 24 años de experiencia en las ventas, su negocio lo inicio con capital propio para apoyar a su esposo en ese tiempo, por que actualmente esta separada de el. Este es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic el cual invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, productos de higiene personal, lácteos, jugos y gaseosas, para aumentar las ventas ya que es lo que el cliente consume diario. Agradece a la institución por la oportunidad de los préstamos ya que a podido invertir en su negocio y cubrir las necesidades personales. A futuro espera mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Elena is 57 years old. She lives with her two adult children in the Monseñor Lezcano neighborhood in the capital of Managua. Maria Elena has 24 years of experience managing her own grocery store. She started her business using her own capital so that she could support her husband at the time, but now they are separated.

She is in her third loan cycle with AFODENIC and will use the money to buy basic grains, personal hygiene products, dairy products, juices, and sodas to increase her sales. Her customers consume these products on a daily basis. Maria Elena thanks the Institution for providing this credit opportunity so that she can invest in her business and cover her personal necessities. In the future, she hopes to make a few home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, personal hygiene products, dairy products, juices, and sodas

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Héctor tiene 33 años, vive con su esposa (Doris), de la misma edad, y con sus 4 hijos: Juan Carlos de 13,  Darlin de 10, Ani de 2 años y la pequeña Saira de 1 mes de nacida, todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Hace tres años, él y su esposa, poseían una tienda de comestibles la cual, por diversos motivos, tuvieron que cerrar, pues no podían mantener el negocio. Felizmente con todos los esfuerzos que han estado haciendo podrán reabrirla, es por ello que están muy contentos y con todas las ganas de hacerlo pronto, ya que es un proceso largo, pues deben refaccionar el local, comprar algunos mostradores, los comestibles, etc. Héctor actualmente trabaja en una fábrica de ladrillos, él se mantendrá trabajando ahí mientras que su esposa atenderá la tienda, ya que con su pequeña bebé debe permanecer en casa y pendiente de sus necesidades.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, él siempre ha sido un hombre muy responsable en todos sus pagos y lo hará así con este crédito. Con el dinero que solicita hará realidad la meta de reabrir su tienda para poder brindarle un negocio más tranquilo a su esposa, quien debe atender a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Héctor is 33 years old and lives in his own home. He and his wife Doris (who is the same age) have 4 children: Juan Carlos (age 13), Darlin (age 10), Ani (age 2) and little Saira (age 1 month). Three years ago, Héctor and his wife owned a grocery store that they were forced to close because they were not able to stay in business. Happily they have invested a lot of effort into reopening the business and are looking forward to making it happen. However, the process is taking some time because they must renovate the space, install shelving, acquire merchandise, etc. Hector currently works at a brick factory and will continue to do while his wife attends to the store and watches their little baby at the same time.

This is Héctor’s third loan with MFP. He has been very responsible with all of his payments and will do the same with this loan. With the money he requested, he will fulfill his goal of reopening his store and providing a quieter business that his wife can manage while taking care of their young daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reopen his grocery store

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer muy luchadora, tiene 37 años y no se cansa de trabajar todo el día. Vive con su esposo (German), quien tiene 39 años, y con sus dos inquietas niñas; Yoselin de 17 y Carolina de 10 años.

Ella se levanta al amanecer para atender a su familia, después colabora en la cocina de un comedor popular cerca de su casa. Ya en la tarde alista su cocina y empieza a preparar salchipapas (salchichas y papas fritas), para venderlas a sus vecinos y amistades. Para ello, instala su cocina afuera de su casa y empieza la venta. 
A Nelly le gusta esforzarse para sacar adelante a su familia y trabaja en todo aquello que le pueda generar ganancias. También vende los fines de semana cervezas a consignación, en el mes de octubre vende turrones (postres), los cuales son muy demandados en los meses de setiembre a octubre, ya que se celebra el “mes morado” por la imagen de “Señor de los milagros”, tradición religiosa popular donde se celebran procesiones con rezos y cánticos alabando. Y en el mes navideño vende panteones. Nelly se ingenia el tipo de negocio según la época del año. 

Es su tercer préstamo con MFP y quiere invertir bien el dinero para seguir saliendo adelante. Por lo que tiene planeado mejorar su cocina e invertirlo en mercadería.
texts.en:
Nelly is a 37 year old go-getter, who never tires of working all day. She lives with her husband (German) who is 39 years old, and their two active daughters, Yocelin (17) and Carolina (10). She gets up at dawn to attend to her family, and afterwards she works in the kitchen of a popular eatery near her house. In the afternoon she prepares salchipapas (a typical Peruvian dish of sausages and fried potatoes) in her own kitchen to sell to neighbors and friends. To do this, she installed a kitchen outside her home where she can also sell. Nelly likes to work hard to move her family ahead, and works in any way she can to generate earnings. On the weekends she sells beer on consignment, and during the month of October she sells turrones (nougat candy), for which there is high demand in the months of September and October. This is the time of the celebrations of "mes morado" (purple month), a popular religious tradition where people show their devotion to “Señor de los milagros” with processions involving prayer and hymns. During the Christmas season she sells panettone (sweet bread). Nelly manages the business according to the season of the year. This is her third loan with MFP and she wants to invest the money well so as to continue to advance her business. For this reason she is planning to improve her kitchen and invest in merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise and improve her kitchen

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
Diane M. is a 37-year-old woman and lives in the town of Vaimoso Fou.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To make a living, Diane  runs a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling baked goods in the local community.  Diane has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 2009 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Diane joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Diane is requesting for the first time, a loan from SPBD.    Diane is requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  Diane plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve and expand her business.

Diane was not affected by the tsunami which hit Samoa on 9/29/09. 

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo (Joaquín), de 42 años, y con sus 2 hijos: Edileth de 6 y Adriana de 2 años de edad, en su casa propia.

Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de gorras y lentes para el sol, actividad a cual le pone todas sus energías, ya que desde tempranas horas sale de su humilde y lejana casa transportando su mercadería para llevarla hasta uno de los mercados más concurridos del distrito donde vive. Ella realiza la venta de forma ambulatoria y así logra los ingresos necesarios para el sustento y los gastos de su familia. A Virginia le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues le permite tener libertad sobre sus horarios y poder distribuirlo entre sus hijas y el trabajo en su hogar, aunque algunas veces le resulta muy cansado, ya que su trabajo es de lunes a domingo. Felizmente las ventas con buenas y Virginia espera seguir creciendo y progresando en esta actividad, para que en un futuro pueda tener un puesto propio en el mercado y así tener mayor estabilidad.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sabido responder muy bien en los pagos, al igual que su en banco comunal donde todas sus compañeras se esmeran en serlo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería en lentes y gorras y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Virginia is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Joaquin (age 42) and their chidren, Edileth (age 6) and Adriana (age 2).

She has been selling caps and sunglasses for four years, an activity that requires all of her energy. In the early morning hours, Virginia carries her merchandise from her modest home to one of the busiest markets in their district. She works as a travelling merchant and her income enables her to pay for her family’s expenses. Virginia enjoys her work, which allows her the freedom to establish her own schedule and devote time to her children and her housework. Sometimes the job can be tiring because she works Monday through Sunday. Fortunately, sales have been good and Virginia expects her business will continue growing. In the future, she hopes to have her own vending post in the market and experience greater stability.

This is her third loan with MFP. Like the other members of her Communal Bank, Virginia has been very responsible with her payments. The money she is requesting will be used to buy a large quantity of caps and sunglasses so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of caps & sunglasses

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter es una alegre persona, tiene 46 años y vive con su pareja y su hijo Jean Carlos de 16 años de edad, todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años él se ha dedicado a brindar servicio de taxi, ya que siempre tuvo inclinación hacia el manejo de autos, gustándole desde que era muy joven. Walter recuerda que comenzó su trabajo como cobrador en microbus de transporte público y posteriormente a fue chofer de un auto que alquiló. Es así que desde entonces se dedica a esta actividad con mucha alegría, ya que se distrae mucho realizándolo, pues recorre diferentes distritos de la ciudad. 
Pero salir desde muy tempranas horas en la mañana y regresar tarde en la noche le resulta muy cansado; además, a veces se encuentra con pasajeros problemáticos que no quieren pagar la tarifa. Felizmente él ama su trabajo y quiere seguir progresando y gracias a los duros esfuerzos que hizo logró refaccionar su propio auto y ahora trabaja muy orgulloso en él, pues se ahorra el pago del alquiler logrando mejores ingresos.

Este es su 4to préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita refaccionará su auto para brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
