Walter is a cheerful person. He is 46 years old and lives in his own home with his partner and their 16 year old son Jean Carlos. Walter has been providing taxi services for 10 years. He has always had an inclination for driving cars, since he was fascinated by them as a kid. Walter says he began working as a public bus driver and later as a chauffeur of a rented car. He takes pleasure in all of his jobs because they have provided a distraction from reality and he gets to travel to different parts of the city.

Walter begins his day in the early morning hours and returns home tired very late at night. He has encountered problems with passengers who refuse to pay their cab fare. Fortunately, he loves his job and wants to continue succeeding through his hard work. Walter has managed to repair his own vehicle, which gives him a feeling of satisfaction. Since he does not have to rent a vehicle, he is able to save more of his income.

This will be Walter’s fourth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. He has always been known to be punctual with his payments. With the money he requested, he will make repairs to his vehicle so that he can provide better service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia es una socia muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali, tiene 62 años, es madre D. tres hijos todos mayores D. edad, Virginia se dedica a la venta D. repuestos D. motos y motocarro, este negocio funciona en su casa, ella trabaja junto a su esposo. Integra el Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” desD. hace ocho años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles, que invirtió en la compra D. lubricantes, ahora Virginia necesita un crédito D. 3000 soles que será para comprar llantas D. motos y posteriormente vender. La meta D. Virginia es seguir trabajando para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Virginia is a hard working, happy member of society. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region. She is a 62 year old mother of three grownup children. Virginia sells spare parts for motorbikes and “motocarros” (three wheeled motorized vehicles). She works out of her home, alongsiD. her husband. She joined “Mujeres Valientes”, the Courageous Women Communal Bank, eight years ago. She first obtained a loan for 300 soles, which allowed her to buy lubricants. Now Virginia requires a loan of 3000 soles in order to buy motorcycle tires which she will later sell. Virginia’s goal is to continue to work towards increasing her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motorcycle tires

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Victor A. Rodríguez A., tiene 43 años la edad, casado y tiene 2 hijos uno de 16 años y otro de 5 años que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar fertilizante para la siembra y mantenimiento del café. Hace muchos años que el se dedica a la agricultura pero tiene deseos de crecer. Es el primer préstamo que realiza con FUDECOSUR.Su finca es de 3 hectáreas en la cual tiene sembrado café. El no tenía problemas con su finca, pero el quiere crecer y tener una finca provechosa y productiva, la cual desea heredar a sus hijos en un futuro. Él desea que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales, para ello está trabajando duro para poder brindarles todo lo necesario para que tengan una buena educación y se preparen para la vida.
texts.en:
Victor A. Rodríguez A. is 43 years old, married, and has 2 children (ages 16 and 5) who are his top priority. He wants to buy fertilizers that will be used in planting and maintaining his coffee crop. Victor has been farming for many years and has the desire to expand.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has 3 hectares of farmland that are designated for growing coffee. Victor has not had any problems with his farm, but he wants it to grow so that it will continue to be fruitful and productive and can be passed along to his children in the future. He wants his children to continue studying and become professionals, so he is working hard to provide them everything they need to have a good education and be prepared for life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for his coffee crop

loans.name: Maria Beatriz

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nueva Semilla se formó en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se  caracteriza por los cuatro ríos que la bañan, los hábiles artesanos y su suculenta gastronomía atrae a turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

El Bankito Nueva Semilla está conformado por un grupo de mujeres que tienen como objetivo la superación  propia y de su familia mediante la capacitación y su inserción en el desarrollo de  la micro empresa para mejorar su situación económica y su calidad de vida.

La señora María Beatriz  A. J. es una de las socias activas del  Banco Comunal Nueva Semilla, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca tiene 32 años de edad es casada y madre de dos niños de 8 y 4 años, su hija mayor estudia en la escuela Luisa de Jesús Cordero, viven en casa de su mamá en un departamento independiente, su esposo trabaja en la construcción por  lo que no tiene muchos ingresos.

María  tiene un pequeño bazar y papeleria desde hace dos años en casa de su madre y como no paga arriendo le ha permitido ir incrementado con cabinas telefónicas y con la venta de todo tipo de videos.

Ella lleva  un año y medio trabajando en la banca comunal y nos manifiesta que los créditos obtenidos los ha invertido en la implementación de las cabinas telefónicas y la adquisición  de videos,  con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir en la compra de artículos de bazar como  regalos, perfumes, vajillas, adornos y papelería como cuadernos, pinturas, marcadores y la lista de útiles escolares para sus hijos.

Su sueño es llegar a tener su propia casa y también un auto.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Semilla” (New Seed) Communal Bank began in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for the four rivers that flow through it, its' skillful artists and its' gastronomic delights that attract both national and international tourists. “Nueva Semilla” is made up of a group of women dedicated to training in the development of small businesses in order to improve their economic situation and the quality of their lives. Mrs. María Beatriz A. J. is one of the active members of the communal bank “Nueva Semilla”. She lives in the city of Cuenca. She is a 32 year old, married mother of two children, 8 and 4 years old. Her oldest daughter studies at the Luisa de Jesús Cordero School. The family lives in a private apartment within her mother’s house. Her husband works in construction and does not have a large income. For the past two years, María has a run a small bazaar and stationary store out of her mother’s house. Because she does not pay rent, she has been able to grow her business by adding in telephone booths and video sales. She has been working with the communal bank for a year and a half. The loans that she has obtained have been clearly used to bring in the telephone booths and acquire videos to sell. With the loan from the FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR she will buy small articles to sell in her bazaar such as gifts, perfumes, tableware, ornaments, notebooks, paints, markers and the list of school supplies for her children. Her dreams is to own her own house and also a car.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small articles to sell in her store

loans.name: Fuerza En Cristo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fuerza en Cristo está conformado por Darling del Rosario L. P., María Adelia L., Mercedes del Carmen S. y Juan José P. R.. Ellos son provenientes del valle de la laguna un pueblo pesquero.

La joven Darling L. P. desde hace cinco años se dedica a la costura. Ella está casada y tiene un pequeño de dos años el cual la inspira e impulsa para seguir adelante.

 María L. de 47 años desde 1974 trabaja con productos químicos de limpieza como el pinesol y la cliorina. Productos que se consumen regularmente en los hogares.

Mercedes del Carmen S. de 44 años tiene una pequeña venta y compra y vende cosechas que este en la época.

 Juan José P. R. de 25 años hace cinco años creó su propia panadería luego de haber trabajado en una panaderia en una donde aprendió el oficio. El trabaja junto a su esposa quien lo apoya incondicionalmente y su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The Fuerza en Cristo (Strength in Christ) group is made up of Darling del Rosario L. P., María Adelia L., Mercedes del Carmen S. and Juan José P. R.. They reside in Valle de la Laguna, a fishing village.

Young Darling L. P. has been engaged in dressmaking for five years. She is married and has a two year old little boy who inspires her and drives her to get ahead.

Since 1974, Maria L., age 47, has worked selling chemical cleaning products such as Pinesol and disinfectant— products that are used regularly in households.

Mercedes del Carmen S., age 44, has a small shop and buys and sells seasonal produce.

Juan José P. R., age 25, began his own bakery five years ago after having worked in a bakery where he learned the trade. He works with his wife who supports him unconditionally, and his goal is to finish his house.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To but fabrics, buttons, thread, etc.

loans.name: Maria Zola Margarita

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Pablo está en la comunidad de Rumiloma en la zona sur a unos 20 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, aquí la mayor parte la gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería por la fertilidad de la tierra, además podemos disfrutar de un paisaje sin igual de la serrania ecuatoriana mezcla de colores por los diferentes productos que se cultivan atrayendo a turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

La señora María Zola Margarita Fernández Fernández  es  socia activa  del banco comunal San Pablo ella vive en la comunidad de Guariviña, tiene 48 años de edad  es casada concibió seis hijos de 33, 29, 28, 25, 24, 23 años, sus tres  primeros hijos ya son casados, viven en casa es propia fruto de mucho esfuerzo que comparte con su esposo los tres hijos menores y dos nietos a los que quiere mucho, su esposo trabaja como conductor de un taxi de la localidad.

María Zola se dedica a la venta de  chuzos y salchipapas en una vieja carreta en el centro de la ciudad  desde hace 28 años, su horario de trabajo es de 4 de la tarde a 10 de la noche por lo que sus hijos le ayudan en  su negocio.

Este es su segundo ciclo trabajando con los prestamos de la fundación ofrece y con ellos ha podido solventar las necesidades de su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir en la compra de una nueva carreta  para mejorar la apariencia de su negocio y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

Su meta es llegar a terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The community bank San Pablo is located in the community of Rumiloma in the southern zone, about 20 minutes from the city of Cuenca. Most people there work in agriculture and livestock because of the fertility of the land. There you can also enjoy a landscape without equal in the Equatorian mountain range, where a mix of colours from the different products they cultivate attracts tourists from Equador and abroad. María Zola Margarita Fernández Fernández is an active member of the community bank San Pablo. She lives in the community of Guariviña, is 48 years old and is married. She has six children of 33, 29, 28, 25, 24 and 23 years of age. Her first three children are already married. She lives in a house which is the fruit of much effort with her husband, three younger children and two grandchildren who she loves very much. Her husband works as a local taxi driver. María Zola has been selling chicken skewers and fried potatoes with sausage from an old cart in the city centre for the last 28 years. Her daily timetable is from four in the afternoon until ten at night, which is why her children help her with her business. This is her second cycle working with the loans that Kiva's field partner foundation offers and with them she has been able to settle all the necessary expenses of her business. She will invest the new loan that FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR (Foundation of Hope) grants her in the purchase of a new cart to improve the appearance of her business and provide a better service for her customers. Her goal is to finish her house.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cart to improve her business' appearance and service

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nueva Semilla se formó en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se  caracteriza por los cuatro ríos que bañan la ciudad, sus hábiles artesanos y su suculenta gastronomía atrae a turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

El Bankito Nueva Semilla está conformado por un grupo de mujeres que tienen como objetivo la superación  propia y de su familia mediante la capacitación y su inserción en el desarrollo de  la micro empresa para mejorar su situación económica y su calidad de vida.

La señora María Carmen  A. L. es socia del  Banco Comunal Nueva Semilla, vive en las afueras de la Ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad el Carmen de Guzho  sector Tierra Blanca, María  tiene 51  años de edad es casada y fruto de su unión  engendró ocho  hijos de 29, 27, 23, 22, 19, 15, 13, 11 años, sus cuatro  primeros hijos ya son casados, y su hija de 19 años pasa en casa ya que sufre de reumatismo con el hijo de trece años que ya no estudia y ayuda en algo con los quehaceres del hogar,  su hijo de 15 años trabaja con ella en la colocación de piso flotante y su último hijo estudia en la escuela José Rafael Arízaga  de la comunidad. Su esposo trabaja en la construcción lo que facilitó para que edifiquen su propia casa.

María se dedica a la cría de  animales como cuyes, chanchos y gallinas, debe distribuir su tiempo con otras actividades como los quehaceres del hogar y en ayudar a su hijo a colocar piso flotante en casas que le contratan.

Nuestra socia  lleva dos años trabajando  en la banca comunal lo que le ha permitido comprar sus animales para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y manifiesta  que el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue va a comprar  más  pollos y cuyes que son de rápido crecimiento así como comida y vitaminas.

El sueño de María es ver que sus hijos salgan adelante con el ejemplo que ella les da.
texts.en:
The community bank Nueva Semilla was formed in the city of Cuenca. This city is characterised by the four rivers that bathe the city, its people´s artisanal skills and succulent gastronomy which attracts tourists from Equador and abroad. El Bankito Nueva Semilla is made up of a group of women who share the goal of improving their own situation and that of their family through training and initiation into micro-business development to improve their economic situation and quality of life. María Carmen A. L. is a member of the community bank Nueva Semilla. She lives on the outskirts of Cuenca in the Carmen de Guzho community, located in the Tierra Blanca district. María is 51 years old and married, and the fruit of her marriage has produced eight children of 29, 27, 23, 22, 19, 15, 13 and 11 years of age. Her first four children are already married. Her 19 year old daughter stays at home since she suffers from rheumatism. Her 13 year old son no longer studies but helps her with domestic chores. Her 15 year old son works with her laying laminated floors and her youngest child studies at José Rafael Arízaga community school. Her husband works in construction, which helped them to build their own house. María raises guinea pigs, pigs and hens. She has to spread her time to include other activities such as domestic chores and helping her son to lay laminated floors in the houses where he is contracted. María has spent two years working with the community bank, which has allowed her to buy her animals to help her husband with living costs. She says that she will use the loan that FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR (Foundation of Hope) grants her to buy more chickens and guinea pigs which grow rapidly, as well as food and vitamins. María's dream is to see her children get ahead by the example that she gives them.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more chickens, guinea pigs, food and vitamins

loans.name: Maritza Jaqueline

texts.es:
La señora Maritza Sánchez Véles es socia del Banco Comunal Everes ubicado  en la comunidad de Palo  Quemado en la provincia de Manabí un lugar tranquilo donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura.

Maritza tiene 36 años está casada con Manuel desde hace 21 años y tienen  cinco hijos de 20, 16, 12, 11, 7 años, vive en casa de sus suegros.

Maritza se dedica a la compra y venta de maní para lo cual  ha tenido que arrendar un terreno de dos cuadras para sembrar este producto cada cuatro meses para luego cosechar y vender, ella trabaja con su esposo y da empleo a  dos personas de su comunidad que se encargan de sembrar.

Una vez cosechado el maní pasa al  proceso de tostar y moler para  venderlo  por libras en las tiendas de su comunidad actividad que la realiza Martiza, ya que ella argumenta que el trabajo debe ser compartido.

Con el préstamo  que le entregue la fundación ESPOIR   invertirá  en la compra de  maní para sembrar en los próximos meses de invierno y tratar de mejorar su producción y dar empleo a más personas.

Maritza al igual que muchas socias también tiene un sueño y es precisamente estudiar una carrera agrícola para mejorar sus técnicas de producción de maní, así como  otras alternativas de productos de ciclo corto, además considera que nada es imposible mientras uno tenga las ganas y el deseo de superación.
texts.en:
Maritza Sánchez Véles is a member of the Everes Communal Bank located in the Palo Quemado community in the province of Manabí. It is a peaceful agricultural community. She has been married to Manuel for 21 years and they have five children, aged 20, 16, 12, 11, and 7. They live in Manuel’s parents’ house.

Maritza is in the peanut business. She rents land to plant a crop every four months. She works with her husband and also hires two others from the community for planting. Once harvested, the peanuts are roasted and ground, and then sold by the pound in local stores. Maritza believes that this part of the work should be shared.

With this loan from ESPOIR, Maritza will purchase seed peanuts to plant in the coming winter months. She will try to increase production and employ more people.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seed peanuts to increase production and employ more people

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina es una madre de familia de 32 años. Vive feliz con su esposo José Luis que tiene 38 años de edad y con sus 3 hijos: Mayte de 11, Keiko de 5 y Matías de 3 años.
Hace dos años tuvo la idea de empezar un negocio rentable, donde ella misma sería su jefe. Es así como se inició en la preparación y venta de queques, los cuales vendía a sus hijos y amistades. Al poco tiempo el negocio creció y empezó a preparar tortas y otros bocaditos, comenzó a tener pedidos para matrimonios, fiestas de promoción, bautizos y cuanto evento realizaban sus vecinos y conocidos. 
A ella le agrada mucho elaborar estos deliciosos postres, ya que en cada uno de ellos vierte mucho cariño y dedicación, aunque muchas veces no puede darse abasto para elaborar todos los pedidos que le realizan, pero esto significa que sus postres son muy solicitados es por ello que siente muchas ganas de salir adelante y poder brindarle a su familia un futuro mejor. 

Es su séptimo préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos, al igual que todos los miembros de su grupo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayores cantidades de ingredientes para sus postres, los cuales adquirirá al por mayor, pues de esta forma son más económicos.
texts.en:
Georgina is a 32 year old housewife. She lives with her husband, José Luis, who is 38 years of age and with her three children: Mayte, 11; Keiko, 5; and Matías, age 3.

Two years ago, she had the idea of beginning a profitable business in which she would be her own boss. As a result, she began preparing and selling cakes, which she used to sell to relatives and friends. After a short time, the business grew and she began to prepare pies and snacks. She began to receive orders for weddings, promotion celebrations, baptisms, and events organized by neighbors and acquaintances.

It is very satisfying to her to make these delicious desserts since she pours affection and dedication into each one. Although often she can’t fill the orders that are given to her, this shows that her desserts are quite sought after. This is why she feels able to get ahead and offer her family a better future.

This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she has always been very punctual in making all her payments, just like all the members of her group. With the money she is applying for she will buy greater quantities of ingredients for her desserts. She will acquire these ingredients at wholesale since this is more economical.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for making desserts

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es una alegre mujer D. 57 años D. edad, vive con su hija (María), D. 14 años, quien es su principal alegría; ellas viven en su casa propia. DesD. hace 7 años se dedica al tejido D. chompas, arte que aprendió desD. pequeña D. su madre y gracias a ello, hoy en día, pueD. tener un pequeño negocio D. tejido D. chompas, chalinas, guantes, gorros, etc., las cuales elabora por pedido.
Actualmente, Nelly se encuentra trabajando en un pedido que le hicieron, es por ello que no tiene mucha disponibilidad, pues esta actividad requiere D. todo su tiempo, siendo muy cansado, pero gracias a su experiencia pueD. avanzar mucho más rápido; además, en el transcurro, aprenD. otras técnicas D. tejido como el enmallado.
Pero Nelly no se dedica sólo a esto, siendo ella muy trabajadora; por las tardes, ayudada por su hija, venD. salchipapas (plato tradicional elaborado con papas y salchichas fritas), donD. obtiene algunas ganancias extras.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en comprar mayor cantidad D. productos (ingrediente), al por mayor, para cocinar sus ricas salchipapas. También comprará lana y algunas herramientas para tejer.
texts.en:
Nelly, a happy woman who is 57 years old, lives with her daughter, Maria, who is 14 and is her greatest happiness. They live in their own house. For the last 7 years Nelly has worked weaving sweaters, an art that she learned while young from her mother. Thanks to that she is able today to have a small business weaving sweaters, neckties, gloves, caps, etc. which she makes to order. Currently Nelly is working on an order she received so she does not have much availability since this work requires all her time. She is very tired but thanks to her experience she is able to move ahead more rapidly. Also, in the process she is learning other techniques for weaving, such as using mesh. But Nelly does not work only at that. Being very hard working, in the afternoons assisted by her daughter, she sells salchipapas (a traditional dish maD. with potatoes and fried sausages) from which she obtains some extra income. This is her second loan with MFP and she has always been known to be punctual in all her payments. She will invest the money she is now requesting to buy a large quantity of products (ingredients) at wholesale, to cook her rich salchipapas. She will also buy wool and some tools for weaving.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool for weaving and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Doña Barbará Group

texts.es:
El grupo Doña Barbara está conformado por cuatros mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras y con visión. Una de ellas es Martha Veronica G. de 32 años que comercializa productos de la Avon, marca de productos de cosméticos de gran reconocimiento.

María Lucia M. de 69 años hace once años que vende leña, frijoles cocidos, tortillas, pinolillo y pinol. Estos productos son de gran de manda en su comunidad ya que son parte de la dieta alimenticia.

 Margarita de los Ángeles Gómez Guzmán  de 33 años vende productos de la Avon y cosa de horno que es hecho a base de maíz y queso.  Martha Isabel García M. de 46 años vende desde hace seis años ropa usada y Karla Patricia V. de 38 años desde hace cuatro años que tiene un modesto taller de costura.
texts.en:
The Doña Barbara Group consists of five strong-willed, hardworking, visionary women. One of them is Martha Veronica G.. She sells Avon products, a well-known brand of cosmetic products.

María Lucia M. is 69 years old and has been selling firewood, cooked beans, tortillas, pinole, and pinolillo for 11 years. These products sell well in the community because they are a regular part of the local diet.

Margarita de los Ángeles Gómez Guzmán is 33 years old and sells Avon products. She also sells baked goods made from corn and cheese.

Martha Isabel García M. is 46 years old and has been selling secondhand clothing for 6 years.

Karla Patricia V. is 38 years old and has been operating a modest sewing workshop for 4 years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter es un joven soltero de 28 años, vive con sus padres en su acogedora casa en un populoso distrito de la ciudad de Lima. Él es taxista y desde hace 6 años, se dedica a tiempo completo a este oficio. Ser chofer no es fácil, pues es un trabajo muy sacrificado, y esto lo sabe bien Walter que sale desde muy temprano de su casa para movilizar a personas que tal vez nunca ha visto en su vida, pero que confían en él para que los transporte.
Este carismático taxista trabaja de lunes a sábado durante todo el día porque el trabajo es rentable y debe mantener a sus padres y además, progresar personalmente. 
Así transcurren los días de Walter, entre calles y autos, avanzando en la vida y buscando cumplir sus metas. El quiere mejorar su auto, su única herramienta de trabajo, y con este préstamo piensa cambiar el motor, ya que el actual está fallando.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos los pagos. Con el nuevo motor que piensa comprar podrá manejar seguro y no dejar de conducir. Su meta a futuro es poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Walter is a single young man who is 28 years old. He lives with his parents in a cramped home, located in a crowded district in the city of Lima. He has worked full-time as a taxi driver for the past 6 years. His job is not easy and requires tremendous sacrifice. Walter knows he has to leave the house early in order to find customers. Most of these people are complete strangers who he has never met before, but rely on him for transportation.

Walter is a charismatic driver who works Monday through Saturday all day because the work generates good income and enables him to support his parents and grow on a personal level. As he spends his days driving through the streets, Walter dreams of advancing in life and fulfilling his goals. He wants to repair his car, his only tool for work, because the current engine is failing. He will use his loan to purchase a replacement.

This will be Walter’s second loan with MFP. He promises to be punctual with all of his payments. Along with a new motor, he plans to buy insurance so that he can continue driving. His future goal is to provide a better quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new motor for his vehicle

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL EBENEZER

Desde su juventud el Sr Adrian se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanías tales como instrumentos musicales de viento, hace 15 años,  negocio que le ha traído algunas satisfacciones ya que pudo construir parte de su casa y aportar para los gastos en casa. El socio es el presidente de la Alcancía Comunal EBENEZER es una persona que inspira respeto, al igual que los demás socios son personas responsable y puntual en sus pagos.
Nelly es la tesorera del grupo, ella tiene una bodega que viene atendiendo por más de 5 años, eso la ayudo a costear la educación de sus hijos, ahora reconoce que la situación está muy difícil, pero la única manera de progresar es seguir trabajando.
La secretaria del grupo es Elena una mujer muy dedicada al trabajo, ella hace tejidos a crochet que los vende en el mercado, además atiende pedidos en cantidades, pero cuando no tiene pedidos se dedica a la venta de dulces y  golosinas de forma ambulatoria, aunque tiene pocas ganancias ella sigue perseverante.

Los socios tienen diferente tipos de negocio así que el préstamo otorgado será para la compra de productos e insumos que le permiten aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ever since he was young, Mr. Adrian has been dedicated to making and selling crafts like woodwind instruments. He started this business 15 years ago, and it has brought him the satisfaction of being able to build part of his house and to provide income for the household costs. He is the president of the Alcancía Comunal EBENEZER group, and is a person who inspires respect much like how the rest of the members are responsible people who make punctual payments. Nelly is the treasurer of the group, and she has a small store that she has been keeping for more than 5 years. This helped with the tuition prices for her children, and now she realizes that while the situation is very difficult, if she wants to make progress she must continue working The group's secretary is Elena, a woman who is very dedicated to her work. She makes crochet products which she sells in the market, and she also does large orders, but when she doesn't have orders she sells sweets and candies . Even though she gets few sales, she continues to persevere. The members all have different kinds of businesses so the loan will be for buying products and inputs that allow them to augment the capital that their work earns.

Translated from Spanish by Mitchell Usher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise to sell

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María V. V. de 38 años es de la Montañita zona rural de Masaya y propicia para la agricultura. Ella desde que era una niña junto con sus padres aprendió a cultivar la tierra y ahora esta traspasando este conocimiento a sus cinco hijos los cuales le ayudan a cultivar sus parcelas.

V. es una mujer trabajadora, con principios y dispuesta a seguir adelante. Ella cultiva yuca, maíz, frijoles y arroz.
texts.en:
María V. V. is 38 years old and lives in a rural mountainous area of Masaya that is suitable for farming. As a young girl, she learned from her parents how to cultivate the land. María is now passing that knowledge to her five children who help her cultivate their plots.

She is a hardworking woman who has principles and a desire to move forward. María grows cassava, corn, beans, and rice.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase urea, fertilizers, and seeds

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 52 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y dos de sus cuatro hijos en la urbanización Las Brisas, en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace proximadamente 13 años vende comida en un pequeño puesto dentro del mercado de la ciudad de Lambayeque, situado a 15 minutos de Chiclayo, todos los días atiende a sus clientes desde las 11:30 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, su puesto es muy frecuentado debido a su trato amable y la buena sazón de los platos que ofrece.

Este negocio le ayuda a mantenerse activa y  apoyar a su familia, su esposo trabaja como auxiliar dentro de la universidad pública de la zona y con el dinero que ambos perciben ayudan a los estudios universitarios de sus hijos.

La continua demanda por los platos que vende ha hecho que Rosa piense en preparar más platos que ofrecer a sus clientes, motivo por el cual está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de insumos para seguir preparando comida (arroz, azúcar, menestras, aceite y fideos).

Su mas grande anhelo es instalar en su casa una pequeña bodega con la cual su familia pueda seguir progresando. Rosa es una mujer muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos y clientes que las consideran una mujer sencilla y trabajadora
texts.en:
Rosa is a 52 year old mother who lives with her husband and two of her four children in the urban neighborhood of Las Brisas, which is in the city of Chiclayo.

For approximately 13 years, she has been selling food from a small market stall in the city of Lambayeque, which is 15 minutes away from Chiclayo. Every day she attends to her customers from 11:30am until 5pm. Her vending stall is quite popular because of Rosa’s excellent service and the good seasoning of the dishes she offers.

This business enables her to remain active and generate income to support her family. Her husband works as an assistant at the public university in the area. With the money from both of their incomes, they are able to pay for their children’s college education.

Because of the continuous demand that she experiences, Rosa believes she has to prepare more dishes to offer to her customers. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edypme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles. She will use the money to purchase supplies to continue preparing her dishes (rice, sugar, beans, oil, and noodles).

Her greatest wish is to open a small grocery store in her home so that her family can continue to move forward. Rosa is well-known and respected by her neighbors. Her customers view her as a modest hardworking woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer muy luchadora, a pesar de tener 59 años no se detiene en la vida y sola ha sacado adelante a su único hijo (José), que tiene 40 años y con quien vive en un populoso distrito al sur de la ciudad. No ha sido fácil pero lo ha logrado con esfuerzo y dedicación, y aún trabaja para seguir saliendo adelante.

Desde hace 6 años se levanta muy temprano a preparar desayunos en una cafetería que tiene dentro de una empresa. A diario debe atender a muchos comensales y también en el local vende diferentes productos, como golosinas y gaseosas; y ya en la tarde, ofrece almuerzo a sus clientes. Ella casi no descansa porque le gusta mucho su trabajo y la entretiene, además de darle buenas ganancias económicas. Y como a veces no se abastece sola en el negocio, es por eso que le ayuda una sobrina, sobretodo en las mañanas cuando hay más gente.
Es así que piensa ampliar el negocio, surtirlo con más productos que dejen satisfechos a sus clientes para obtener más ganancias económicas que le permitan tener una buena calidad de vida y ayudar a sus nietos.

Aunque es su primer préstamo con MFP, sabe que debe ser puntual y así lo ha sido siempre, es por eso que ha podido salir adelante criando a su único hijo. Ella conoce muy bien a las integrantes de su banco comunal y está satisfecha porque todas son mujeres luchadoras como ella. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio y crecer aun más en la vida, porque para ella “cada día es un día nuevo”.
texts.en:
Hilda is a strong-willed woman. Despite being 59 years old, she does not let age prevent her from having a life. Hilda is motivated to succeed by her only son José, who is 40 years old and lives in a populous district in the southern part of the city. Things have not been easy for her, but she perseveres with great effort and dedication. She continues working in order to move forward.

For six years, Hilda has been waking up early to prepare breakfast in her café that is situated next to another business. She serves many people on a daily basis and also sells other products from her establishment, such as candy and soft drinks. In the afternoons, she offers lunch to her customers. Hilda takes very little rest because she enjoys her work so much and finds it both entertaining and profitable. Most of the time she works alone, but sometimes her niece comes by to help in the mornings when there are more people. Hilda has plans to expand her business and restock it with more supplies so that her customers leave satisfied. Additional revenue would provide her a good quality of life and enable her to help her grandchildren.

Even though this will be her first loan with MFP, Hilda knows that she must make her payments on time. She has demonstrated she is responsible by successfully raising her only son. Hilda is well known among the other members of her Communal Bank and fits in with the rest of the group because they are all fighters just like her. The money she requested will be used to buy more merchandise for her business. She hopes to grow even more in life, because for her “every day is a new day.”

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise for her inventory

loans.name: Sabina Asunción

texts.es:
Sabina Asunción V. de 44 años desde 1991 se recorre las calles desde muy temprano ofreciendo ropa de todos los estilos y golosinas. Este oficio lo aprendió de su madre y con él a sostenido a sus cuatro hijos todos menores de edad. Su hija mayor es quien le ayuda en el negocio.

Ella lleva 14 créditos en Adim con los cuales se ayuda mucho y ha visto crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Sabina Asunción V. is 44 years old. Since 1991, she has been selling candy and all styles of clothing as a street merchant. She learned this trade from her mother and has been able to support her 4 dependent children. Her eldest daughter helps her with the business.

Sabina has taken advantage of 14 previous loans with ADIM, which have helped her tremendously in growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & candy to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 50 años y está felizmente casada con el  amor de su vida, Raúl, de 57 años, con quien tiene dos hijos, que son motivo de su dedicación; Mayra de 13 y Raúl de 14 años. Un buen día ella pensó en iniciar un negocio, pero no sabía cual hasta que vio las necesidades de su familia, y entonces empezó a comprar ropa y  venderla a sus familiares y vecinos. 

Es así como empezó a dedicarse a este negocio y a obtener buenas ganancias económicas. Hoy en día vende singulares polos, lindos vestidos y diferente ropa que le piden, ella vende al crédito, para luego cobrar; es así como puede ayudar en los gastos del hogar a su esposo y comprarse sus algunas cosas personales. A Rosa le gusta mucho su trabajo y sabe que tiene demanda, no solo por los novedosos vestuarios que vende, si no también porque ella tiene mucho carisma y capacidad de convencimiento, que son fundamentales para tener más clientes. Para el futuro, Rosa quisiera tener una boutique, pero sabe que con esfuerzo y dedicación algún día lo logrará.

Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y está convencida que sólo si es puntual y responsable seguirá progresando en la vida. Tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en ropa, con la cual podrá incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50 years old and happily married to the love of her life Raúl, who is 57 years old. They have two children, Mayra (age 13) and Raúl (age 14), who motivate them to continue working. Rosa always thought of starting a business, but she did not take action until she realized that she had to begin contributing toward the needs of her family. As a result, she started buying clothes and selling them to relatives and neighbors. As a result of her business, Rosa started generating a good income. Today she sells signature polos, beautiful dress suits, and other types of clothing by request. She sells on credit and collects payments at a later time. Her earnings have enabled her to help her husband with the household expenses and purchase a few personal items. Rosa enjoys her work and knows that there is great demand for the novelty clothing that she sells. She also possesses a charismatic personality and abilities of persuasion, fundamental qualities needed to attract more customers. In the future, Rosa would like to open a boutique. With hard work and dedication, she knows that can happen someday. Rosa is taking her sixth loan with MFP. She is convinced that if she is punctual and responsible, she will continue to succeed in life. With the money she requested, Rosa plans to acquire more clothing so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge es una padre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el sector El Tabacal, distrito de Túcume, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la agricultura, anteriormente trabajaba como obrero agrícola de manera eventual pero esta actividad no le daba los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia; empezó a arrendar un terreno cercano a su casa y desde entonces se ha dedicado a la agricultura de manera constante.

Actualmente se encuentra cosechando su sembrio de frijol pallar, el ha solicitado ayuda a algunos vecinos para terminar exitosamente esta acción pero no tiene dinero para pagarles, es por este motivo que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la paga de jornales dentro del trabajo de cosecha que viene realizando.

El es un padre muy responsable que trata de sacar adelante a sus hijos, actualmente dos de ellos estudian y los otros dos lo apoyan en las actividades agrícolas. Su más grande anhelo es poder adquirir un terreno propio en el cual seguir sembrando.

Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 42 year old father who lives with his wife and four children in the neighborhood of El Tabacal in Túcume District, which is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been engaged in agriculture for 15 years. Jorge previously worked as a casual farm laborer, but this job did not provide enough income to support his family. He decided to rent a field near his home and has been devoted to farming on a regular basis.

Jorge is currently harvesting his crop of lima beans. He has requested assistance from some of his neighbors to help finish harvesting his crops, but he does not have the money to pay them. For this reason, he has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 soles so that he can pay wages for the harvest work being done.

Jorge is a father who is very responsible in raising his children. Two of his children currently attend school while the other two help with the farming chores. His greatest wish is to acquire his own land so that he can continue farming.

This is the second time Jorge has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa. He has demonstrated that he is responsible and punctual with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for labor needed to harvest his crop of lima beans

loans.name: Berlisa

texts.en: Berlisa M. is from the village of Mabini, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental.  She is 51 years old. Berlisa is married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Berlisa owns and operates a business venture in retailing. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of variety of goods in the local community. Berlisa has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP net a month for these activities. In 2005, Berlisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Berlisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. Berlisa is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used for additional capital of sari-sari store. This loan will be the 3rd cycle loan taken out by Berlisa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional Capital of her retail store

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda A. is from the village of Rizal, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 50 years old. Melinda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Melinda owns & operates a business venture in the food sector by making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Melinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Melinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. Melinda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Melinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El Sr. Rubén Q. R. tiene 30 años de edad y vive en casa de sus padres en Asentamiento Humano Los Ficus – Camino a Huacachina – ciudad de Ica. 
Ellos les han brindado dos ambientes para que él habite junto a su hija de 8 años la cual asiste a un colegio de la zona. El Sr. esta separado de su pareja desde hace 2 años y él es quien se encarga de los gastos de su hija. 
Cuenta con experiencia crediticia en otra entidad donde ha cancelado puntualmente y se dedica al transporte desde hace 8 años.
Con sus ahorros ha logrado comprar una mototaxi de segunda lo que le permite un mejor ingreso y así poder comprar un juego de dormitorio y mejorar el ambiente de la habitación de su menor hija.
Es un hombre muy emprendedor y luchador, sigue adelante por su hija quien es su motivo de vivir. Ha logrado acumular bienes. Goza de buenas referencias y los vecinos dicen que es bien trabajador.
texts.en:
Sr. Rubén Q. R. is 30 years old and lives in his parents’ house in the settlement of Los Fica located along Huacachina Road in the city of Ica. His parents have provided two rooms for him and his eight year old daughter, who attends a local school. Rubén has been separated from his partner for the past 2 years, so he is in charge of his daughter’s expenses. He took out a previous loan with another institution and repaid it on time. Rubén has been working in the transportation sector for 8 years. With his savings, he was able to purchase a secondhand motorcycle taxi. This enabled him to generate a better income so that he could buy a bedroom set and perform renovations to his daughter’s room. Rubén is a determined, hardworking man. He continues to press forward for the sake of his daughter, who is his reason for living. He has good references and his neighbors say he is a good worker.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perform renovations to his daughter's room

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy E. is from the town of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga,  Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Mercy is married and has one child. To make a living, Mercy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Mercy is just starting her farming business.

In 2005, Mercy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase the land where she raises crops. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Mercy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase the land where she raises crops

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Mrs. Sara D. is from the village of Doyong, Punta Miray, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old, married and blessed with 4 school-aged children. She owns and operates a business venture in fishing and selling the catch to the local community. She joined PMPC October 6, 2005 to have access to their programs and services. She earns a monthly net income from her business of 4,000.00 PHP. 
Currently, she's availing her 8th cycle loan in the amount of PHP 7,500 for the purpose of additional capital for her fishing business. Now, with the loan she is able to have enough supply of fingerlings.
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For purchase of fingerlings

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida B. is from the village of Magsaysay, Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 49 years old. Leonida is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonida owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Leonida has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leonida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elmar

texts.en:
Elmar C. is from the village of Del Pilar, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Elmar is married and has 4 adult-aged children. In 2001, Elmar joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. Elmar has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Elmar is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used for house renovation. This loan will be the 5th cycle loan taken out by Elmar from PMPC.
 About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house improvement

loans.name: Emierissa

texts.en:
Emierissa  is from the town of Solinog,Calamba, Misamis Occidental.  She is 34 years old.  To make a living, Emierissa owns & operates a business venture in retail. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of clothes in the local community. 
 In 2008, Emierissa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emierissa has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Emierissa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emierissa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. loans.name: Exson Ivan

texts.es:
El Sr. Exson Ivan S. T. de 22 años de edad y vive con su conviviente la Sra. Mirian Lili Huarcaya Carlos de 21 años de edad. Ellos tienen una niña de 2 años de edad la cual es su impulso para seguir adelante. 
Cuentan con casa propia en la zona de Pariña Chico perteneciente al Distrito de los Aquijes en Ica – Perú. 
Trabaja en un Tico (Automóvil – taxi) alquilado desde hace 3 años de 7:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. en la ruta Ica- Los Aquijes y Los Aquijes – Ica. 
Gozan de buenas referencias, no cuentan con experiencia crediticia ya que los pocos bienes que han ido acumulando lo han obtenido siempre al contado con los ahorros obtenidos de su trabajo.
Solicitan el crédito para mejorar la fachada de su casa y poder colocar lunas a su puerta y ventana ya que se encuentran actualmente con cartones desde hace años. Además desean empezar a tener experiencia crediticia para más adelante obtener un financiamiento mayor y poder comprarse una unidad propia que le permita un mejor ingreso y así poder mejorar su vivienda para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su niña que aun esta pequeña. 
Son personas bien responsables a pesar de su edad, sobretodo con bastante ansias de superación.
texts.en:
Sr. Exson Ivan S. T. is 22 years old and lives with his partner, Sra. Mirian Lili Huarcaya Carlos, who is 21 years old. They have a 2 year old daughter who is their motivation to move forward. Exson and his family live in their own home in the Pariña Chico neighborhood, which is in the district of Los Aquijes in Ica, Peru. He has been driving a rented “tico” (taxi) for 3 years. His work schedule is from 7am to 7pm, and he makes several trips between Ica and Los Aquijes. Exson has good references, but he does not have credit experience since he has accumulated few assets and has paid with cash from the savings he sets aside from his work income. He is requesting a loan to improve the façade of his house and install glass in all the windows and doors because they are currently covered with cardboard. Exson would also like to establish a credit record so that he can obtain future financing to purchase an upgraded vehicle. This will enable him to earn a better income so that he can make other home improvements and provide his family with a better quality of life while his daughter is still young. Despite their young age, Exson and his wife are responsible people who have the desire to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. Anarosa is not affected by tsunami which hit Samoa on 29th September 2009. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Gatundu Baraka Group

texts.en:
The Gatundu Baraka borrowing group consists of four men and four women and is located in Gatundu town, outside of Thika. The members are each receiving 20,000 KES from this group loan. They are engaged in a range of businesses, including tailoring, motorcycle driving, clothes boutiques, mali-mali (house product sales), and a restaurant.  

The group leader is George Mwangi W. and his business is selling shoes and charcoal. His main challenge is lack of funds for expansion, so he is using this loan to increase his inventory of both shoes and charcoal. Like many other entrepreneurs in the area, his goal is to become a wholesaler. By his own description, George is friendly, honest, warm, and tries to be a peacemaker. He has five children, the eldest being 38 years old. George's dream is to send his youngest child, currently in the fourth form, to university.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and charcoal to sell
